In the perfect circle scenario, China had easy access to raw materials because it had the cash to pay whatever the market demanded. The US had no incentive to disrupt China’s shipping because it served the interests of the US for the goods to arrive. The noise and pushback around job losses in the US was never enough to truly jeopardise the perfect circle, given the benefits that came to both countries.

现在完美的循环被打破了，利益冲突更加明显。中国感觉更容易受到任何可能的航道中断的影响，尤其是在后阿拉伯之春的世界中很明显，食品和能源价格上涨是社会动荡的催化剂。美国及其盟国主宰太空、网络空间和海浪这一事实给人的印象是，美国可以扰乱或阻断这种交通。当缺乏粮食库存使中国对任何供应中断高度敏感时，这是一个至关重要的实际问题。

Now that the perfect circle is broken, conflicting interests are far more apparent. China feels much more vulnerable to any possible disruption of the shipping lanes, especially in a post-Arab Spring world where it is clear that higher food and energy prices are a catalyst for social unrest. The fact that the US and its allies dominate space, cyberspace and the ocean waves creates the impression that the US could disrupt or interdict that traffic. This is a crucial practical problem when a lack of food stocks renders China highly sensitive to any supply disruption.

恰巧在南海发现的天然气也引发了该地区的一个新问题。现代技术现在允许在看似微不足道的岩石下的海床中有利可图地收获能源、食物和矿产资产，这些岩石构成了许多亚洲国家声称属于自己的领土。对于能源匮乏的中国及其邻国来说，石油和天然气比以往任何时候都更有价值。油价可能已经下跌，但获得当地供应仍然很有价值。

It also happens that natural gas finds in the South China Sea have ignited a new issue in the region. Modern technology now allows the profitable harvesting of the energy, food and mineral assets in the seabed underneath the seemingly insignificant rocks that form the territories that many Asian nations claim as their own. Oil and gas are more valuable than ever to both energy-starved China and its energy-starved neighbours. The oil price may have fallen but access to a local supply is still valuable.

进一步激化这些争端的是该地区民族主义和民粹主义的兴起。随着亚洲工人开始意识到他们可能不会在年老之前变得富有，他们开始质疑为什么他们社会中的财富被分配给了其他人而不是他们自己。市民们在问：“为什么富人如此富有而穷人如此贫穷？” “为什么允许腐败？” “如果现任领导人不为我的最大利益服务，为什么还要负责？” 这些政治压力必然要求这些国家的领导层从战略安全的角度证明他们能够保护国家利益。他们必须证明他们可以避免会伤害人口的食品和能源供应问题。毕竟，领导层已经与中国公众签订了社会契约。

Further inflaming these disputes is the rise of nationalism and populism in the region. As Asian workers begin to realise they might not get rich before they get old, they start to question why the wealth in their societies is being distributed to someone else and not to them. Citizens are asking, ‘Why are the rich so rich and the poor so poor?’ ‘Why is corruption permitted?’ ‘Why should the current leaders be in charge if they are not serving my best interests?’ These political pressures necessarily require the leadership in these countries to demonstrate that they can protect the national interest from a strategic security point of view. They have to show they can avoid food and energy-supply problems that would hurt the population. After all, the leadership have made a social contract with the Chinese public. They have promised to double per capita income by 2020.

鱼

Fish

让我们不要忘记世界上大约 10% 的鱼类供应来自这些海洋这一事实。鱼的价格在 2013 年创下历史新高，并在 2015/2016 年再次创下历史新高，因此中国及其邻国有理由担心谁控制了这一关键的鱼源蛋白质。9因此，关于鱼类的争论愈演愈烈，尤其是在牛肉、猪肉、家禽甚至大豆等其他蛋白质的价格不断上涨的情况下。中国渔船和军舰与邻国的对抗越来越多。

Let us not forget the fact that some 10 per cent of the world’s fish supply comes from these seas. The price of fish hit an all-time-record high in 2013, and is doing so again in 2015/2016, so China and its neighbours are justifiably concerned about who controls that critical source of protein.9 Arguments over fish are therefore intensifying, especially as the price of other proteins such as beef, pork, poultry and even soy keep rising. There have been an increasing number of confrontations between Chinese fishing and military vessels and those of neighbouring nations.

中国所有的“渔船”现在都在中国人民解放军的主持下。10中国人将渔船用于军事目的由来已久。如今，这些渔船通常涂成中国人民解放军海军的灰色，虽然乍一看似乎配备了渔具，但它们也携带着情报收集设备。美国一些人称792型船为“情报拖网渔船”。“这些渔船被称为‘幽灵’或‘小蓝人’。美国海军战争学院的一位教授曾表示，“虽然俄罗斯在克里米亚的小绿人家喻户晓，但对中国在南海的小蓝人却没有给予足够的重视。”11与此同时，中国人认为美国喜欢以非常相似的方式使用海洋“研究船”。

All ‘fishing vessels’ in China now come under the auspices of the People’s Liberation Army.10 The Chinese have a long history of using fishing vessels for military purposes. Today these fishing vessels are often painted in People’s Liberation Army Navy grey and, though they might at first glance appear to be equipped with fishing gear, they also carry intelligence-gathering equipment. Some in the US call the Type-792 class boats ‘intelligence trawlers’. ‘These fishing vessels are called ‘phantoms’ or ‘little blue men’. One US Naval War College Professor has said, ‘While Russia’s little green men in Crimea are widely known, insufficient attention has been paid to China’s little blue men in the South China Sea.’11 Meanwhile, the Chinese believe that the US likes to use oceanographic ‘research vessels’ in a very similar way.

白菜策略

Cabbage strategy

捕鱼和捕鱼不是冲突的唯一驱动力；物理存在是另一个。《纽约时报》援引中国最高级将领之一的话说，描述了中国在南海的“白菜战略”：

Fishing and fish are not the only drivers of conflict; physical presence is another. The New York Times described China’s ‘Cabbage Strategy’ in the South China Sea by quoting one of China’s most senior generals:

“自（对峙）以来，我们已开始采取措施封锁和控制黄岩岛周边地区，”中国人民解放军少将张兆忠在 5 月接受电视采访时说。士嘉堡。（同一组不适合居住的岩石有三个不同的名称，这可以告诉您有关该地区的许多信息。）他描述了一种“卷心菜策略”，该策略需要用如此多的船只围绕一个有争议的地区——渔民、渔业管理部门舰船、海监船、海军军舰——“岛屿因此像卷心菜一样一层一层包裹”。12

‘Since [the standoff], we have begun to take measures to seal and control the areas around the Huangyan Island,’ Major General Zhang Zhaozhong, of China’s People’s Liberation Army, said in a television interview in May, using the Chinese term for Scarborough. (That there are three different names for the same set of uninhabitable rocks tells you much of what you need to know about the region.) He described a ‘cabbage strategy’ which entails surrounding a contested area with so many boats – fishermen, fishing administration ships, marine surveillance ships, navy warships – that ‘the island is thus wrapped layer by layer like a cabbage’.12

最近，尽管许多政府对这些地区的主权存在争议，但中国更愿意将南海和近海的部分地区归为己有。在最近的一个例子中，似乎至少有 100 艘来自中国人民解放军海军 (PLAN) 的海军舰艇包围了一个天然气钻井平台，越南声称该钻井平台是中国声称对其领土的非法行为。越南和中国船只用高压水炮对峙并相互撞击。最终，中国拆除了钻井平台，但在充分展示白菜战略的威力之前没有这样做。

Recently China has become more willing to claim parts of the South and Near China Seas as its own, even though sovereignty of these areas is disputed by many governments. In a recent example, it seems at least 100 naval vessels from the People Liberation Army Navy (PLAN), which surrounded a gas rig that Vietnam claims is an illegal effort by China to claim their territory. Vietnamese and Chinese vessels faced off with water cannons and rammed each other. Ultimately China removed the drilling rig, but not before fully demonstrating how powerful the cabbage strategy is.

在更令人担忧的事态发展中，越南胡志明市的中国工人和中资工厂因当地对这一争端的愤怒而遭到袭击。2014 年 5 月在越南的暴力冲突中，数名中国公民丧生，大约 3,000 名中国人从越南撤离。

In a more concerning development, Chinese workers and Chinese-owned factories in Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam have been attacked as a result of local anger about this dispute. Some 3,000 Chinese were evacuated from Vietnam after several Chinese citizens were killed in the violent confrontations there in May 2014.

南海和东海现在处于一场伟大竞赛的中心。各国正在争夺宝贵的资产：控制航道以及食品和能源供应。这些资产值得为之奋斗。它们代表真实的现金流。从表面上看，美国和美国的盟友在许多共同利益上与中国结盟。然而，在表面之下，在空中，美国和中国在这些战略资产上的冲突越来越多。

The South and East China Sea are now at the heart of a great contest. Countries are fighting for valuable assets: control of shipping lanes and food and energy supplies. These assets are worth fighting for. They represent real cash flows. On the surface of things, the US and America’s allies are aligned with China by many common interests. Below the surface, and in the air, however, the US and China are increasingly in conflict over these strategic assets.

翻转鸟

Flipping the bird

这些信号令人信服。2015 年 10 月 29 日，美国和中国宣布了一项谅解备忘录，双方的军事飞行员同意避免对对方做出猥亵手势。13现在，想象一下，一架间谍飞机和一架战斗机需要有多近，飞行员才能看到另一个人正在向他“扔鸟”。

The signals are compelling. On 29 October 2015, the US and China announced a Memorandum of Understanding in which the military pilots on both sides agreed to refrain from making obscene hand gestures at each other.13 Now, imagine for a moment how close a spy plane and a fighter jet need to be for the pilots to be able to see the other guy is ‘flipping the bird’ at him.

近年来，中国战机与美国侦察机的接触越来越密切。2014 年 8 月 18 日，一架美国最先进的侦察机 P-8 侦察机似乎在海南岛附近飞行。当时中国进行了军事演习，但人们普遍怀疑海南是一个主要的潜艇基地，也是中国新型“航母杀手”潜艇（YJ-12）的所在地，理论上可以从远处攻击美国航母美国宙斯盾战斗系统的极限。它的武器显然比美国的反导弹系统更快。据报道，中国派出一架SU-27战斗机将美国侦察机推开。这导致了类似的新闻头条：“中国刚刚重演了壮志凌云中著名的“小鸟”场景与美国飞机吗？14有消息称，这两架飞机不仅相距不到 20 英尺，而且中国飞行员将他的战斗机“滚桶”越过这架更大、更笨重的间谍飞机，从而表明战斗机腹部的武器完全装载和武装。

Chinese fighter jets and US spy planes have been coming into increasingly close contact in recent years. On 18 August 2014 it seems a US P-8 Spy plane, America’s most sophisticated reconnaissance aircraft, flew near Hainan Island. There were Chinese military exercises at the time, but Hainan is widely suspected to be a major submarine base and the home of China’s new ‘carrier-killer’ submarines (the YJ-12) which can, in theory, attack a US carrier from beyond the limits of an American Aegis combat system. Its weapons are apparently faster than America’s anti-missile systems. It was reported that a Chinese SU-27 fighter jet was sent up to push the US spy plane away. This led to news headlines along the lines: ‘Did China Just Re-Enact the famous “Birdie” Scene from Top Gun With US Plane?’14 Word is that the two planes not only came within twenty feet of each other but the Chinese pilot ‘barrel-rolled’ his fighter jet over the much larger and more lumbering spy plane, thus revealing that the weapons on the fighter jet’s underbelly were fully loaded and armed.

从那以后，出现了更多的“翻转”事件。随着双方争夺对领土的物理控制，所有这些海上船只和飞机越来越近。也许最近的事件可以说明这种情况。

Since then there have been more ‘flipping’ events. All these maritime craft and aircraft keep getting closer as both sides jockey for physical control of territory. Perhaps the most recent events give a flavour of the situation.

USS拉森号和 USS柯蒂斯威尔伯号

USS Lassen and USS Curtis Wilbur

2016 年 1 月 30 日，USS柯蒂斯威尔伯号被派去巡逻海卫一岛，这是有争议的西沙群岛链的一部分15 . 这不是美国驱逐舰在中国感知的领土范围内航行的第一次入侵。2015 年 10 月，USS拉森号在南沙群岛做了同样的事情，故意在永暑礁附近测试渚碧礁 12 英里的界限。在这里，在曾经从太平洋伸出的一系列无人居住的岩石上，中国建造了一条看似军用级的大型跑道。中国商用客机于 2016 年 1 月上旬开始在那里降落，引发了美国和声称拥有全部或部分南沙群岛主权的国家（包括越南和菲律宾）的许多抗议。

On 30 January 2016 the USS Curtis Wilbur was sent in to patrol Triton Island, part of the disputed Paracel Island chain15. It wasn’t the first incursion by an American destroyer navigating within China’s perceived territorial limit. In October 2015 USS Lassen did the same thing in the Spratly Archipelago, deliberately testing the twelve-mile limit of Subi Reef in the vicinity of Fiery Cross. Here, on what was once a series of uninhabited rocks jutting out of the Pacific, China has constructed a large, seemingly military-grade runway. Chinese commercial airliners began making landings there in early January 2016, prompting many protests from the US and the countries that claim all or part of the Spratly Islands, including Vietnam and the Philippines.

中国的反应非常明确：如果美国超过12英里的限制，中国就会开火。奥巴马总统命令柯蒂斯威尔伯号航空母舰无论如何都要继续前进。什么都没有发生，尽管对对抗的恐惧是如此之大，以至于澳大利亚人自愿使用他们的一艘海军舰艇。美国和中国都告诉澳大利亚，直截了当地“闭嘴”。

The Chinese response was very clear: if the US passed beyond the 12-mile limit, the Chinese would open fire. President Obama ordered USS Curtis Wilbur to proceed anyway. Nothing happened, although the fear of a confrontation was so great that the Australians volunteered to use one of their naval vessels. Both the US and China told Australia to, putting it plainly, ‘shut up.’

美中海军舰艇之间的对抗可以追溯到2006年左右。当年10月26日，一艘中国宋级潜艇成功在当时美国在该地区唯一的前沿部署航空母舰“小鹰号”航母战斗群内浮出水面。这意味着潜艇已经到达，完全未被发现，在导弹距离之内，距离航母不到 9 公里。机上 5,500 名人员似乎没有发现它，直到一名正在练习跑步的美国飞行员从飞机上往下看，显然意识到他下方水中的大物体不是鲸鱼。这种“弹出式”惊喜现在已成为标准。

Confrontations between American and Chinese naval vessels date back to about 2006. On 26 October that year a Chinese Song-class submarine managed to surface inside the carrier battle group of the USS Kittyhawk, America’s only forward deployed aircraft carrier in the region at that time. This meant the sub had arrived, completely undetected, well within missile distance, less than 9 kilometres off the carrier itself. It seems it was not spotted by any of the 5,500 personnel on board until an American pilot, who happened to be practising training runs, looked down from his plane and apparently realised the large object in the water below him was not a whale. Such ‘pop-up’ surprises are now standard.

小鹰号航空母舰

USS Kittyhawk

2008年，中国剥夺了“小鹰”号在香港停泊的权利，从而剥夺了许多人员及其家人参加太平洋舰队多年来一直是日程安排的年度感恩节周末的机会。在被无故拒绝离开香港后不久（中国后来称这是“误会”），小鹰号与一艘中国驱逐舰、深圳级和宋级潜艇对峙。基蒂霍克号航空母舰进入了完整的战斗站。对峙持续了一天。美国回应称，中国不会被允许控制美国进入台湾海峡。

In 2008, China denied the Kittyhawk the right to berth in Hong Kong, thus depriving many personnel and their families of the opportunity to participate in the annual Thanksgiving weekend that had been a fixture of the Pacific Fleet’s timetable for many years. Shortly after being turned away from Hong Kong without reason (China later said it was a ‘misunderstanding’), Kittyhawk was confronted by a Chinese destroyer, the Shenzen, and Song-class submarines. USS Kittyhawk went to full battle stations. The stand-off lasted a day. The US responded by stating that China would not be permitted to control American access in the Straits of Taiwan.

考彭斯号和辽宁号

USS Cowpens and the Liaoning

2013 年 12 月 5 日，双方之间的紧张局势升级，其中一艘为中国唯一的航空母舰辽宁舰编队的舰艇几乎与提康德罗加级导弹巡洋舰考彭斯号航空母舰相撞。据新闻报道，中方认为考彭斯在中方控制的海域尾随和骚扰辽宁号。美国人的观点是，当中国人民解放军海军两栖船坞船直接转向考彭斯的路径并停下来时，考彭斯正在国际水域中，两艘船之间的距离不足 500 米。考彭斯号航空母舰被迫采取规避行动以避免碰撞。不管是谁开始的，很明显双方都在互相嘲讽。两个战斗群都在对方的“内部防御层”之内。16

Tension between the two sides escalated on 5 December 2013, when one of the vessels forming an escort for China’s sole aircraft carrier, the Liaoning, almost collided with the USS Cowpens, a Ticonderoga-class guided missile cruiser. According to news reports, the Chinese view was that Cowpens was tailing and harassing the Liaoning within Chinese-controlled waters. The American view was that Cowpens was in international waters when a People’s Liberation Army Navy Amphibious Dock Ship veered directly into the path of the Cowpens and stopped, leaving less than 500 metres between the two ships. USS Cowpens was forced to take evasive action to avoid a collision. Whoever started it, it is clear that both sides were taunting one another. Both battle groups were well within the other’s ‘inner defence layer’.16

由于事关重大，双方相互挑衅，这些紧张局势和分歧日益增加了需要努力化解的冲突幽灵。2014 年初，赫伯特美国太平洋空战作战参谋部执行主任“鹰”卡莱尔说，

With so much at stake and with both sides provoking one another, these tensions and disagreements increasingly raise the spectre of conflicts that would take effort to defuse. In early 2014, Herbert ‘Hawk’ Carlisle, Executive Director of America’s Pacific Air Combat Operations Staff, said,

如果你看看东海发生的一些事情，两军（美国和中国）都非常专业地行事。但是，发生错误、计算错误或误解的可能性是存在的。两国围绕有争议的领土主张开展了更多活动，这对我来说是一种风险。17

If you look at some of the things that have been going on in the East China Sea, both militaries [US and China] have been conducting themselves very professionally. But the potential for something, a mistake to occur or miscalculation or misunderstanding to occur, is out there. There is significantly more activity from both nations around the disputed territorial claims, and that to me is a risk.17

领土主张

Territorial claims

领土分歧集中在南海225万平方公​​里范围内的许多岛屿上的长期争端。18

The territorial disagreements centre on long-standing disputes over the many islands that lie within the 2.25 million square-kilometre radius of the South China Sea.18

亚洲最大和最明显的压力源是台湾岛，它在技术上位于东海，不属于争议岛屿问题，只是中国声称台湾是中国。根据 1979 年《台湾关系法》的条款，美国总统在法律上有一定的义务保卫台湾，因此，虽然关于台湾地位的争论有很多噪音，但中国已经使用经济政策来平息问题。中国允许台湾商界因中国经济而致富。与威胁军事对抗相比，中国通过深化经济联系和鼓励台湾人创造财富在台湾赢得了更多的支持。

The greatest and most obvious source of strain in Asia is the island of Taiwan, which is technically in the East China Sea and not part of the disputed island issue, except that China claims that Taiwan is China. The US President is somewhat obliged by law to defend Taiwan under the terms of the Taiwan Relations Act of 1979, so, while there is a lot of noise in the arguments over Taiwan’s status, China has used economic policy to calm the issues. China permits Taiwan’s business community to become enriched by China’s economy. China wins more support in Taiwan by deepening economic ties and encouraging wealth creation among the Taiwanese than by threatening military confrontation.

虽然台湾是美国在该地区前沿存在的主要原因，而朝鲜构成的核威胁提供了进一步的理由，但中美之间的紧张局势在很大程度上是由围绕中国南方的许多岛屿链的争端所驱动的海。在大多数情况下，这些链条由崎岖的贫瘠之地组成无法居住的岩石，但它们的所有权受到中国及其大多数邻国的有力和军事争夺。

While Taiwan is the primary reason for America’s forward presence in the region, with the nuclear threat posed by North Korea providing further justification, much of the tension between China and the US is driven by disputes over the many chains of islands that riddle the South China Sea. For the most part these chains consist of craggy barren rocks that cannot be inhabited, yet their ownership is forcefully, and militarily, contested by China and most of its neighbours.

按照虚线

Follow the dotted lines

1948 年，一份私人出版的南中国海地图显示了 11 条虚线组成一条线，标明哪些岛屿属于中国，哪些属于台湾管辖。自然，两国政府仍在争论这些破折号应该画在哪里。复杂的因素是该地区的其他政府也声称拥有这些岛屿的所有权。2009年，中国向联合国提交了修改后的九段线地图。这条线靠近该地区所有其他国家的海岸。文莱提出抗议；菲律宾人; 越南和马来西亚，共同提交；甚至印度尼西亚，尽管它没有具体的领土要求。中国的回应是告诉两名美国高级官员，当时的美国国家安全委员会主任杰弗里·巴德和副国务卿詹姆斯·斯坦伯格，19中国曾使用“核心利益”一词来表示不可协商的问题。最初它适用于台湾。2008年首次应用于西藏和新疆。20到 2010 年，它已应用于东海和南海。21换言之，中国试图向外界宣布南海和东海的领土争端为“禁区”。

In 1948 a privately published map of the South China Sea showed eleven dashes forming a line to indicate which islands were owned by China and which were governed by Taiwan. Naturally, the two governments still argue about where those dashes ought to be drawn. The complicating factor is that other governments in the region also claim ownership of those islands. In 2009 China submitted a modified nine-dash-line map to the UN. The line skirted close to the shores of every other nation in the region. Protests were filed by Brunei; the Philippines; Vietnam and Malaysia, which filed jointly; and even Indonesia, though it had no specific territorial claims. China responded by telling two senior US officials, the then US National Security Council Director Jeffrey Bader and Deputy Secretary of State James Steinberg, that this part of the world was now a ‘core interest’ for China.19 The phrase ‘core interest’ has been used by China to indicate when an issue is non-negotiable. Initially it was applied to Taiwan. In 2008 it was applied for the first time to Tibet and to Xinjiang.20 By 2010 it was being applied to the East and South China Seas.21 In other words, China has tried to declare the territorial disputes of the South and East China Seas ‘off limits’ to outside parties.

关于习近平主席对尖阁诸岛使用“核心利益”一词的说法引发了激烈的争论，日本称其为自己的领土。22马丁·登普西将军，当时的主席参谋长联席会议于 2013 年 4 月在北京举行的非公开会议上被告知，“核心利益”一词现在适用于尖阁诸岛。随后，中国外交部发言人华春莹发表声明称，“钓鱼岛（中国对尖阁诸岛的称呼）事关主权和领土完整。当然这是中国的核心利益。23

There is lively debate about President Xi Jinping’s supposed use of the term ‘core interest’ with regard to the Senkaku Islands, which Japan claims as their own.22 General Martin Dempsey, then chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, was told in private meetings in Beijing in April 2013 that the term ‘core interest’ was now applied to the Senkaku. This was quickly followed by a statement by Hua Chunying, a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman, who said, ‘The Diaoyudao Islands [China’s name for the Senkaku] are about sovereignty and territorial integrity. Of course it’s China’s core interest.’23

防空识别区

ADIZ

在 2013 年 11 月的三中全会上，中国宣布成立国家安全委员会。其目的是：巩固现有的外交政策及其基础的国防结构，并对抗“来自国外的敌对反华势力”。24 11 月 23 日，国家在建立新的安理会结构后的第一个行动是宣布设立“东海防空识别区”（ADIZ）。25

At the Third Party Plenum in November 2013, China announced the creation of a National Security Council. Its aim: to consolidate existing foreign policy and the defence structures underlying it, and to counter ‘hostile anti-China forces from abroad.’24 On 23 November the nation’s first action after establishing this new Security Council structure was to announce the creation of an ‘East China Sea Air Defence Identification Zone’ (ADIZ).25

该区域的地图显示，防空识别区覆盖了日本部分地区，并一直延伸到台湾领空，并吞并了韩国的部分领空。春晓/白桦气田正好位于该区域的中部。26

The map of this zone reveals that ADIZ covers some of Japan and extends all the way to Taiwan’s airspace, as well as taking in some of South Korea’s airspace. The Chunxiao/Shirakaba gas field falls right in the middle of the zone.26

美国对建立防空识别区发起了积极的反应，立即派出两架 B52 轰炸机飞越尖阁诸岛/大鱼岛，未经宣布。根据《经济学人》的一篇报道，中国宣布“所有打算进入该区域的飞机都必须向中国当局提交飞行计划，保持无线电通信并听从中国管制员的指示——否则将面临“防御性紧急措施”。B52 没有。顿时僵持不下在世界超级大国和亚洲新兴大国之间。27

The US launched an aggressive response to the creation of ADIZ, immediately sending two B52 bombers over the Senkaku/Daioyu islands, unannounced. According to a report in The Economist, China declared that ‘all aircraft intending to enter the zone had to file flight plans with the Chinese authorities, maintain radio communications and follow the instructions of Chinese controllers – or face “defensive emergency measures”. The B52s did not. Suddenly a stand-off loomed between the world’s superpower and Asia’s emerging great power.’27

韩国人和日本人也开始在未经中国许可的情况下飞入新区。2013 年 12 月上旬，韩国宣布将自己的防空识别区扩大 66,000 平方公里。它现在涵盖了中国声称拥有的部分领土。

The South Koreans and the Japanese also began flying into the new zone without first obtaining China’s permission. South Korea announced the expansion of its own ADIZ in early December 2013 by 66,000 square kilometres. It now covers some of the territory that China claims.

2013年12月，美国国务卿约翰克里表示，领土争端再次升级：

In December 2013, the territorial disputes once again escalated when US Secretary of State John Kerry said:

今天，我对中国宣布划设东海防空识别区深表关切。我告诉外交大臣，美国不承认这个区域，也不接受它。该区域不应实施，中国应避免在该地区其他地方采取类似的单边行动，尤其是在南海。28

Today, I raised our deep concerns about China’s announcement of an East China Sea Air Defence Identification Zone. I told the Foreign Secretary that the United States does not recognise that zone and does not accept it. The zone should not be implemented, and China should refrain from taking similar unilateral actions elsewhere in the region, and particularly over the South China Sea.28

很明显，美国认为中国扩大防空识别区仍有可能，如果不可能的话。

Clearly the US believes that the extension of the ADIZ by China remains possible, if not likely.

来自俄亥俄州的战斧

Tomahawks from Ohio

从中国的角度来看，首先升级的是美国。2010 年，在河内举行的东南亚国家联盟（ASEAN）会议上，国务卿希拉里·克林顿在这个被中国视为敌对组织的地区安全组织面前直接挑战中国。克林顿说，“美国和每个国家一样，在航行自由、开放进入亚洲海洋公域以及尊重南海国际法方面都符合国家利益。”29

From a Chinese perspective, it was the US who escalated first. At a meeting of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in Hanoi in 2010, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton directly challenged China in front of this regional security group, which China views as a congregation of adversaries. Clinton said, ‘The United States, like every nation, has a national interest in freedom of navigation, open access to Asia’s maritime commons, and respect for international law in the South China Sea.’29

这在外交上相当于向空中发射机枪。30如果你错过了，相关的词是“具有国家利益”：声明美国和中国在该地区存在直接对立的利益。31克林顿通过呼吁“解决南沙群岛和南海海上边界的主权争端”显着提升了公海问题。她说这是“首要的外交优先事项”和“对地区安全的关键”。32

This was the diplomatic equivalent of firing a machine gun into the air.30 If you missed it, the relevant words were ‘has a national interest’: a declaration that the US and China have directly opposing interests in the region.31 Clinton significantly elevated the high seas issue by calling for ‘a resolution of the sovereignty dispute over the Spratly Islands and maritime borders in the South China Sea’. She said this was a ‘leading diplomatic priority’ and ‘pivotal to regional security’.32

正如《时代》杂志报道的那样，言语伴随着行动。演讲时，33

Words were accompanied by actions, as reported by Time magazine. At the time of the speech,33

一种新型的美国超级武器突然在附近（中国）浮出水面，这是一艘俄亥俄级潜艇，几十年来它携带的核导弹针对的是苏联，然后是俄罗斯。这一次不同：近三年来，美国海军一直在向不知道哪里的人派遣改进的“婴儿潮”[潜艇]（毕竟它们确实在水下旅行）。18 艘弹道导弹潜艇中有 4 艘不再携带装有核弹头的三叉戟导弹。取而代之的是，它们每个都拥有多达 154 枚战斧巡航导弹，能够用非核弹头击中 1000 英里范围内的任何东西。

A new class of US super weapon suddenly surfaced nearby (China), an Ohio-class submarine, which for decades carried nuclear missiles targeted against the Soviet Union, and then later Russia. This one was different: for nearly three years, the US Navy has been dispatching modified ‘boomers’ [submarines] to who knows where (they do travel underwater, after all). Four of the 18 ballistic-missile subs no longer carry nuclear-tipped Trident missiles. Instead, they hold up to 154 Tomahawk cruise missiles each, capable of hitting anything within 1,000 miles with non-nuclear warheads.

美国还安排多艘航空母舰当天抵达该地区。密歇根号航空母舰出现在韩国，佛罗里达号航空母舰抵达迭戈加西亚，五角大楼称之为“正义营”和“自由足迹”，这是美国在欧亚大陆的能力的核心。迭戈加西亚一直是在阿富汗和伊拉克进行轰炸的主要基地。

The US also arranged for a number of aircraft carriers to arrive in the region that very same day. The USS Michigan appeared in South Korea and the USS Florida arrived in Diego Garcia, an island the Pentagon calls ‘Camp Justice’ and the ‘Footprint of Freedom’, which is central to America’s capabilities across Eurasia. Diego Garcia has been the main base for staging bombing runs on Afghanistan and Iraq.

正如《时代》杂志所说：“总而言之，中国军队一觉醒来发现作为美国在其附近部署的 462 架新战斧。这些是亚音速、远程、低空“智能武器”巡航导弹，是现代战争中最令人恐惧的。难怪有传言说胡主席立即召见了他的安全顾问。中国驻华盛顿特区大使馆发言人说，我们希望美军的有关活动有利于地区的和平、稳定与安全，而不是相反。

As Time put it: ‘In all, the Chinese military awoke to find as many as 462 new Tomahawks deployed by the US in its neighbourhood.’ These are subsonic, long-range, low-altitude ‘smart weapon’ cruise missiles that are the most feared in modern warfare. No wonder it was rumoured that President Hu immediately summoned his security advisors. The spokesman at the Chinese Embassy in Washington DC said, ‘We hope the relevant US military activities will serve for the regional peace, stability and security, and not the contrary.’

空间和网络空间

Space and cyberspace

中国将如何应对这些事态发展？中国已经开始尝试通过建立拥有航空母舰等的“蓝水”海军来与美国及其盟国匹敌。但是，简单地禁用对方的后勤能力可能会更聪明、更便宜、更有效，因此美国和中国在太空（卫星）和网络空间上的高度关注。

How could China respond to these developments? China has started trying to match the US and its allies by building a ‘blue water’ navy with aircraft carriers and the like. But it would probably be smarter, cheaper and more effective to simply disable the other side’s logistical capabilities, hence the intense focus between the US and China on space (satellites) and cyberspace.

白宫于 2010 年 6 月下旬推出了新的“国家太空政策”。这加强了美国对中国的高科技禁令，其中包括禁止所有从事卫星或太空项目的美国公司和美国雇员进入中国或与中国公民有未报告的接触。总体而言，美国的立场是通过控制太空和卫星来阻止中国获得大多数高科技，从而维持对中国的后勤主导地位，这让中国人非常恼火。

The White House launched the new ‘National Space Policy’ in late June 2010. This reinforced the high-tech ban the US maintains on China that, among other things, precludes all US companies and American employees who work on satellites or space projects from entering China or having unreported contact with Chinese nationals. Overall, America’s stance has been to maintain logistical dominance over China by denying it access to most high technology through control over space and satellites, which irks the Chinese terribly.

谷歌是中央情报局/国家安全局吗？

Is Google the CIA/NSA?

中国一直怀疑美国在互联网上的主导地位有邪恶的一面。《连线》杂志的文章“独家：谷歌、CIA 投资网络监控的“未来””只是证实了中国对谷歌是CIA 和 NSA（国家安全局）的怀疑。34具有讽刺意味的是，这些恐惧得到了他们的证实，2013 年 6 月，就在奥巴马总统和习主席在加利福尼亚会晤的那一周，美国总统和许多美国人也是如此。一位名叫爱德华·斯诺登 (Edward Snowden) 的年轻 NSA 官员拿着一个装有 NSA 关键机密信息的拇指驱动器，这些信息揭示了美国对间谍活动的系统性努力中国和美国公民一样。斯诺登直奔中国保护地香港，向世界揭露美国的间谍活动，这或许并非巧合。这一事件进一步向中国证实，美国网络空间努力的中心目标确实是中国。用斯诺登的话来说，“数以千计的技术、金融和制造公司正在与美国国家安全机构密切合作，提供敏感信息并获得包括获取机密情报在内的好处。”35

China has always been suspicious that America’s dominance of the Internet has a nefarious side. Wired magazine’s article, ‘Exclusive: Google, CIA Invest in “Future” of Web Monitoring’ only confirmed China’s suspicion that Google is the CIA and the NSA (National Security Agency).34 Ironically, these fears were confirmed for them, and many Americans as well, the very week that President Obama and President Xi met in California in June 2013. A young NSA officer called Edward Snowden took a thumb drive loaded with critical classified information from the NSA, which revealed America’s systematic efforts to spy on China and on US citizens alike. It is perhaps no coincidence that Snowden went straight to a protectorate of China, Hong Kong, to reveal America’s spying efforts to the world. This event further confirmed for China that the central target of America’s cyberspace efforts is indeed China. In Snowden’s words, ‘Thousands of technology, finance and manufacturing companies are working closely with US national security agencies, providing sensitive information and in return receiving benefits that include access to classified intelligence.’35

这使得奥巴马总统很难继续对中国针对美国目标的网络战进行美国长篇大论。但这并没有阻止美国左派和右派对中国在网络空间进行黑客攻击和间谍活动的广泛性质的抱怨。

This made it hard for President Obama to continue the American tirade against China’s cyber warfare on American targets. But it hasn’t stopped the American left and right alike complaining about the extensive nature of China’s hacking, whacking and espionage activities in cyberspace.

与此同时，美国加大了对中国网络空间能力的言辞。2010 年，曾两次担任中央情报局局长和美国国家安全局退休负责人的四星上将和军事情报官迈克尔·海登谈到中国从西方主要公司窃取工业和国防机密的行动时说：“作为一名情报专业人员，我完全敬畏和惊叹。. . 它的深度、广度和持久性都非常壮观。36

Meanwhile, the US has upped the rhetoric about China’s cyberspace capabilities. In 2010 the four-star general and military intelligence officer Michael Hayden, the twice-former head of the CIA and retired head of the NSA, said of the Chinese campaign to wrest industrial and defence secrets from major Western companies: ‘As an intelligence professional, I stand back in absolute awe and wonder . . . It is magnificent in its depth, its breadth and its persistence.’36

黑客和破坏者

Hackers and whackers

中国的黑客（窃取信息的人）和黑客（破坏系统的人）多次设法进入五角大楼的各个级别，包括各个国防部长的个人笔记本电脑、爱国者导弹系统、F-35联合攻击轰炸机、无声P-C3潜艇技术和许多其他关键防御系统。假设这些目标远远超出军方，包括美国银行、国会、美国电网、技术公司、国防承包商、能源公司、人权组织、律师事务所、私募股权公司和任何其他可以提供有用的实体中国寻找关键硬资产的信息。

China’s hackers (those who steal information) and whackers (those who damage systems) have repeatedly managed to get into the Pentagon at all levels, including the personal laptops of various secretaries of defense, into the Patriot missile systems, the F-35 Joint Strike Bomber, the silent P-C3 submarine technology and many other critical defence systems. It is assumed that these targets go far beyond the military and include US banks, the Congress, America’s power grids, technology firms, defence contractors, energy companies, human rights groups, law firms, private equity firms and any other entities that can provide useful information in China’s search for critical hard assets.

对中国人而言，美国一再试图监视他们并可能抑制他们的内部系统，这激怒了中国人。鉴于美国政府的系统和全面的间谍计划，他们在中国实现了同样的目标渗透是合情合理的。2006年，美国开始在中国上空发射间谍卫星，并解释说它不能看到朝鲜的核威胁而不瞥见中国，这不是它的错。中国的回应是在美国的卫星经过时用陆基激光“致盲”。美国随后转向更高轨道的卫星，却发现中国的反卫星试验证明，即使在高空也能击中美军卫星只是时间问题。美国随后进行了自己的反卫星测试，但他们并没有摧毁整颗卫星，而是只敲掉了它的一个角落，从而证明美国拥有中国所缺乏的东西：精确度。两国在这场比赛中仍然锁定了谁可以扔得更远、更精确。

For their part the Chinese are offended by America’s repeated efforts to spy on them and potentially inhibit their internal systems. Given the US government’s systematic and comprehensive spying programme, it would be a reasonable bet that they have accomplished the same kind of penetration of targets in China. In 2006 the US started sending spy satellites over China, explaining that it wasn’t its fault that it can’t watch the nuclear threat from North Korea without catching a glimpse of China. China responded by ‘blinding’ America’s satellites with land-based lasers as they passed over. The US then shifted to higher-orbit satellites, only to find Chinese anti-satellite tests proved that it was only a matter of time before they could hit a US military satellite even in high altitude. The US then engaged in its own ASAT tests, but instead of destroying the whole satellite, they knocked off just a corner of it, thus proving the US has something China lacks: precision. The two countries remain locked in this competition as to who can throw further and more precisely.

两国长期部署侦察机来对付对方。这就是导致 2001 年 4 月在有争议的西沙群岛发生事故的原因，当时一架来自“世界观察者”中队的美国 EP-3 间谍飞机进入了中国 J-8 间谍飞机的几层油漆中。中国飞行员王伟遇难，美国机组人员被迫在他们一直监视的海南岛紧急降落。美国船员花了一周时间进行紧张的外交谈判才能返回家园。这架飞机是几个月后于 2001 年 7 月返回，完全拆卸。37中国人将挖空的尸体由俄罗斯航空公司 Polet 运送到美国，这无疑是为了说明问题。

Reconnaissance aircraft are permanently deployed by both countries against each other. This is what led to the accident over the disputed Paracel Islands in April 2001, when an American EP-3 spy plane from the ‘Worldwatchers’ Squadron came within a few coats of paint of a Chinese J-8 spy plane. The Chinese pilot, Wang Wei, was killed and the US crew were forced to make an emergency landing on Hainan Island, the very location they had been spying on. It took a week of tense diplomatic negotiations to get the US crew back home. The plane was returned months later in July 2001, fully disassembled.37 The Chinese had the hollowed-out carcass delivered to the US by Polet, the Russian Airline, no doubt to make a point.

中国和美国的间谍飞机继续相互嗡嗡作响，尽管他们现在这样做更加小心了。谁说谁是对的？显而易见的是，有一种新的冷战，它的重点是商品所有权。如果说旧冷战是中央情报局在兰利对莫斯科克格勃，那么网络空间的新战争也许是美国国家安全局在米德堡对上海大同路人民解放军 61398 部队。俄罗斯也参与其中。据信，俄罗斯情报部门使用内部和外包的网络战专家。有人认为，大多数“拒绝服务”网络攻击实际上来自乌克兰。如果这是真的，它为俄罗斯提供了另一个理由来关心谁对这个国家的未来拥有权威。

Chinese and American spy planes continue to buzz each other, though they do so more carefully now. Who’s to say who is right? What is clear is that there is a new kind of Cold War and it is focused on ownership of commodities. If the old Cold War was the CIA in Langley versus the KGB in Moscow, perhaps the new war in cyberspace is the NSA in Fort Meade versus People’s Liberation Army Unit 61398 on the Datong Road in Shanghai. Russia too is involved. It is believed that the Russian intelligence services use internal and outsourced cyberwar experts. It has been argued that the majority of ‘denial of service’ cyber attacks actually come from Ukraine. If this is true, it provides yet another reason for Russia to care who has authority over the future of that nation.

拥抱者和重击者

Huggers and sluggers

中国人很清楚，在谈到中国​​时，美国有两大阵营。有“China Huggers”和“China Sluggers”。38拥抱者希望拥抱中国的改革努力，并协调两国之间的共同利益。中国猛击队专注于两者之间的竞争和冲突利益。猛击队将每一次事件都作为进一步加强美国对潜在敌对中国的军事和技术优势的理由。最终结果是美国官员称之为“对冲策略”。

The Chinese understand very well that there are two broad camps in the US when it comes to China. There are ‘China Huggers’ and ‘China Sluggers’.38 The Huggers want to embrace Chinese efforts to reform and to align the common interests between the two countries. China Sluggers focus on the competing and conflicting interests between the two. The Sluggers take every incident as justification for further enhancing America’s military and technological dominance over a potentially hostile China. The end result has been something US officials call the ‘Hedge Strategy’.

Ashton Carter 和 Jennifer Buckley 在哈佛的《亚太评论》中非常清楚地解释了美国的困境：

Ashton Carter and Jennifer Buckley explained America’s dilemma with great clarity in Harvard’s Pacific Asia Review:

中国的军事未来并不是它向世界隐瞒的秘密——即使对国内的人来说也是一个谜。就连高层领导人也不知道中国在未来几十年会成为美国的朋友还是敌人。. . 鉴于这种战略不确定性，美国别无选择，只能对华实行双管齐下的政策。一方面是与中国接触，并鼓励它成为国际社会的“负责任的利益相关者”。二是对中国的竞争或侵略行为进行“谨慎对冲”，追求持续接触，而不是将国家视为敌人。39

China’s military future is not a secret it keeps from the world – it is a mystery even to those inside the country. Not even top leaders know whether China will become the United States’ friend or foe in the decades ahead . . . Given this strategic uncertainty, the United States has no choice but to pursue a two-pronged policy toward China. One prong is to engage China and encourage it to become a ‘responsible stakeholder’ in the international community. The second is to engage in ‘prudent hedging’ against competitive or aggressive behaviour by China, pursuing continued engagement rather than treating the country as an enemy.39

日本

Japan

猫捉老鼠的另一个方面是中国和日本不断侵入对方领空，从而迫使双方争抢战斗机。中国自 1958 年以来首次侵入日本领空发生在 2012 年末。那一年，日本为应对中国喷气式飞机侵入日本领空而出动了 306 次，创历史新高。这些数字每年都在增加。日本抱怨中国潜艇和船只在日本船只上使用武器瞄准和火控雷达。安倍首相说，“这是一个危险的举动，可能导致不可预见的情况。” . . 在有迹象表明中日可能进行谈判的时候，中国进行这种片面的挑衅，令人极为遗憾。40

Another aspect of cat and mouse is apparent from the continuing intrusions by China and Japan into each other’s airspace, thus forcing both sides to scramble their fighter jets. China’s first incursion into Japanese airspace since 1958 took place in late 2012. That year, Japan scrambled a record 306 times in response to Chinese jets breaching Japanese airspace. These numbers have increased each year. Japan has complained about Chinese submarines and ships using weapons-targeting and fire-control radar on Japanese vessels. Prime Minister Abe said, ‘This was a dangerous action that could lead to unforeseen circumstances . . . At a time when there were signs that there could be talks between China and Japan, it is extremely regrettable that China should carry out such a one-sided provocation.’40

此外，现在经常看到中国军舰在北海道以北的宗谷海峡和日本认为的第一个“防御边界”的“第一岛链”周围的海道上绕日本航行。这是从冲绳到台湾的。日本的“第二岛链”从日本南部岛屿一直延伸到关岛。现在这里是中国军舰演习的地点。2012 年 9 月 11 日，日本政府从“日本私人所有者”手中购买了有争议的尖阁地区的一些小岛，这让中国非常懊恼。中国船只显然“在 229 天和 54 天”派遣军舰进入尖阁诸岛和日本领海。41

In addition, Chinese military vessels are now regularly seen moving around Japan in sea-lanes as far north as the Soya Strait north of Hokkaido and around the ‘first island chain’ that Japan considers its first ‘Defence perimeter’. This runs from Okinawa to Taiwan. Japan’s ‘second island chain’ runs from Japan’s southern islands all the way to Guam. This is now the site for drills by Chinese military vessels. On 11 September 2012 the government of Japan purchased a number of small islands in the disputed Senkaku area from their ‘private Japanese owner’, much to China’s chagrin. Chinese ships apparently sent military vessels into the Senkakus ‘on 229 days and Japanese territorial waters around the islands on 54 days’.41

俄罗斯也一直在日本周围嗡嗡作响，俄罗斯熊轰炸机、支点战斗机和核潜艇的访问。日本和俄罗斯从未通过签署和平条约正式结束第二次世界大战。他们仍然对日本北部的千岛群岛存在争议。（后者是一个长期存在的问题；自江户时代以来，两国一直在为这些岛屿争论不休。）42

Russia, too, has been buzzing around Japan with visits by Russian Bear Bombers, Fulcrum Fighter jets and nuclear submarines. Japan and Russia have never formally ended the Second World War by signing a peace treaty. They remain in dispute over the Kuril Islands in north Japan. (The latter is a long-standing issue; the two countries have been arguing over these islands since the Edo period.)42

量化宽松作为国防政策

QE as defence policy

这种增加的战略威胁部分是导致日本首相安倍宣布日本创纪录的量化宽松政策的部分原因。日本在一年内将基础货币翻了一番。中国人很清楚，这不是一个纯粹的经济决定。通过刺激经济，安倍首相相信他可以支持他的主要目标：重新武装日本。预计凯恩斯主义经济政策将扩大和支持经济，使其更容易在国防上花费更多，而这本身会进一步刺激经济活动。

This increased strategic threat is in part what led Japanese Prime Minister Abe to announce the record quantitative easing in Japan. Japan doubled the monetary base in a single year. The Chinese know full well that this was not a purely economic decision. By stimulating the economy, Prime Minister Abe believes he can support his principal goal: the rearmament of Japan. Keynesian economic policy is expected to expand and support the economy, making it easier to spend more on defence, which itself further stimulates economic activity.

扩大经济政策旨在让日本在威胁感知日益增强的情况下加强其防御能力。首相呼吁修改宪法，以允许日本摆脱二战后施加的限制。迄今为止，日本只被允许维持“自卫队”，日本的自卫完全依赖美国。现在首相要正式重新建立日本海军、日本陆军和日本空军。日本呼吁使用旧的“旭日”旗帜，并以帝国海军军舰的名字命名其新海军舰艇，以此唤起过去它是该地区主要侵略者的日子。他们的第一艘直升机航母被称为出云号——以 1937 年上海战役中击败中国的旗舰船命名。

Expanding economic policy is intended to allow Japan to strengthen its defence capabilities at a time of increasing threat perception. The Prime Minister has called for a change to the Constitution to permit Japan to be removed from the constraints imposed in the aftermath of the Second World War. Until now, Japan has only been permitted to maintain a ‘self-defence force’, leaving Japan to rely entirely on the US for its defence. Now the Prime Minister wants to formally re-establish a Japanese Navy, a Japanese Army and a Japanese Air Force. Japan is evoking bygone days when it was the major aggressor in the region by calling for the use of the old ‘Rising Sun’ flag and naming its new naval vessels after Imperial Navy warships. Their first helicopter carrier was called the Izumo – named after the flagship vessel that defeated China in 1937 during the battle of Shanghai.

在中美在太平洋地区日益激烈的外交博弈中，日本被中国视为美国在该地区的一只手臂。美国和日本在防务方面的合作越多，这种观念就越强。2014 年 2 月，日本防卫大臣岸田文雄暗示，如果存在“明显且当前的危险”，美国将允许在日本境内部署核武器。显然，这种与过去政策的潜在重大突破是针对中国的。

In the ever-intensifying game of diplomatic chess between the US and China in the Pacific, Japan is viewed by China as an arm of the US in the region. The more the US and Japan collaborate on defence, the more this notion is reinforced. In February 2014 the Japanese Defence Minister, Fumio Kishida, hinted that US nuclear weapons would be permitted to be deployed inside Japanese territory if there were a ‘clear and present danger’. Clearly this potentially significant break with past policy is aimed at China.

魂器

Horcruxes

与此同时，来自地缘政治的信号正更加响亮地震动着经济笼子。彭博社发表了一篇题为“如何防止中日战争”的文章，43因此承认来自日本和中国这两个国家的信号都不是积极的。2013 年底，当中国驻英国大使刘晓明在《每日电讯报》上写道：

Meanwhile, the signals from geopolitics are rattling the economic cage ever more loudly. Bloomberg posted a story entitled ‘How to Prevent a War Between China and Japan’,43 thus acknowledging that the signals from both countries, Japan and China, are not positive. One such signal emanated from the pages of the British press at the end of 2013 when the Chinese Ambassador to the United Kingdom, Liu Xiaoming, wrote in the Daily Telegraph:

在哈利波特的故事中，黑暗巫师伏地魔死得很惨，因为包含他部分灵魂的七个魂器被摧毁了。如果说军国主义就像日本的伏地魔，那么东京的靖国神社就是一种魂器，代表着这个国家灵魂最黑暗的部分。44

In the Harry Potter story, the dark wizard Voldemort dies hard because the seven horcruxes, which contain parts of his soul, have been destroyed. If militarism is like the haunting Voldemort of Japan, the Yasukuni Shrine in Tokyo is a kind of horcrux, representing the darkest parts of that nation’s soul.44

几天后，日本驻英国大使也在《每日电讯报》上回应说：“有两条通往中国的道路。一是寻求对话，遵守法治。另一个是通过放开军备竞赛和紧张局势升级的邪恶，在该地区扮演伏地魔的角色。45

Japan’s Ambassador to the United Kingdom responded a few days later, also in the Daily Telegraph: ‘There are two paths open to China. One is to seek dialogue, and abide by the rule of law. The other is to play the role of Voldemort in the region by letting loose the evil of an arms race and escalation of tensions.’45

ED问题

ED problems

2014 年 2 月，美国国务院东亚和太平洋事务局助理国务卿丹尼尔·R·拉塞尔在国会证词中宣布，美国不承认中国的“九段线”：“任何使用“九段线”的行为。中国不根据所主张的地物主张海洋权利的“划线”将不符合国际法。46同年 5 月，中国在越南认为在其领土内的水域放置了一个石油钻井平台，并用 100 多艘海军舰艇和 5 架战斗机开始保护该钻井平台。美国国务卿哈格尔说，“中国采取了破坏稳定的单方面行动，主张其在南海的主张”。47作为回应，中国解放军国防大学院长、两星上将朱成虎表示，美国患有“扩展部署”，他接着说，“已成为男性型 ED 问题：勃起功能障碍'。48

In February 2014, Daniel R. Russel, Assistant Secretary of the US State Department’s Bureau of East Asian and Pacific Affairs, announced in Congressional testimony that the US does not recognise China’s ‘Nine-dash Line’: ‘Any use of the “Nine-dash Line” by China to claim maritime rights not based on claimed land features would be inconsistent with international law.’46 In May that same year, China placed an oil rig in waters that Vietnam perceived to be within their territory and proceeded to protect the rig with more than one hundred naval vessels and five fighter jets. US Secretary of State Hagel said, ‘China has undertaken destabilising, unilateral actions asserting its claims in the South China Sea’.47 In response, Zhu Chenghu, a two-star general who is the dean of China’s PLA National Defence University, said that America suffers from ‘extended deployment’ which, he went on, ‘has become the male type of ED problem: erectile dysfunction’.48

2014 年 7 月，习近平主席以不那么幽默的口吻说：“中美合作将成就对两国和世界都有利的事情，而对抗将是灾难性的。” 显然，值得关注这个问题发出的信号。

On a less humorous note, President Xi Jinping said in July 2014: ‘Sino-US cooperation will achieve things that are beneficial to both countries and the world, while confrontation will be disastrous.’ Clearly it is worth paying attention to the signals emanating from this issue.

管理期望

Managing expectations

我们这个时代的重大社会问题之一，对于世界和中国而言，将是向 10 亿中国工人发布消息，更不用说所有其他新兴市场工人了：“我们非常抱歉，但你不再是在世界经济中具有竞争力，所以是时候回到农场，降低您的期望，我们期待着您在发明新的商业模式时收到您的来信，因为廉价劳动力不再为您工作了。

One of the great social issues of our time, for the world and for China, will be breaking the news to one billion Chinese workers, let alone all the other emerging-market workers: ‘We’re terribly sorry, but you are no longer competitive in the world economy, so it’s time to go back to the farm, reduce your expectations and we look forward to hearing from you when you invent a new business model now that cheap labour is not working for you any more.’

正如老歌的标题所说，“你如何将他们留在农场（在他们看到帕雷之后）？” 中国睾丸激素丰富而现金匮乏的工人不会安静地回家，所有与中国竞争的新兴市场工人也不会。Huggers 和 Sluggers 都担心中国和新兴市场的不稳定，就像这些国家的领导层一样。

As the old song title goes, ‘How Ya Gonna Keep ’em Down on the Farm (After They’ve Seen Paree)?’ China’s testosterone-rich and cash-poor workers will not go home quietly, and neither will all the emerging-market workers that compete with China. Huggers and Sluggers alike fear instability in China and across emerging markets as much as the leadership of these nations do.

简而言之，美国对中国抱最好的希望，做最坏的打算。同样，中国对美国抱最好的希望，做最坏的打算。无论共和党还是民主党掌权，无论是强硬派还是改革派在北京掌权，情况都是如此。

In short, America hopes for the best and prepares for the worst when it comes to China. Similarly, China hopes for the best and prepares for the worst when it comes to the US. This is true whether Republicans or Democrats are in power, and whether hardliners or reformers are in charge in Beijing.

美国和中国都在该地区部署越来越多的军事资产，为最坏的情况做准备。其中包括船舶、航空母舰、基地站、通信、网络能力以及与地区合作伙伴的深化关系。

The US and China alike prepare for the worst by placing more and more military assets in the region. These include ships, aircraft carriers, basing stations, communications, cyber capability and deepened relationships with regional partners.

一带一路

OBOR

然而，中国有一个新的回应将深刻改变这种情况：“一带一路”或“一带一路”。习近平主席宣布了一个非常聪明的想法，将中国从我所描述的各种压力中拯救出来。2013年10月，他宣布中国有意建设“一带一路”。“一带一路”是我们熟知的丝绸之路，始于中国西安，一路到达威尼斯、雅典的比雷埃夫斯港、马德里和德国杜伊斯堡、荷兰安特卫普和比利时列日的铁路枢纽。

There is, however, a new response from China which will profoundly alter the situation: OBOR or One Belt One Road. President Xi Jinping announced a very clever idea to save China from the various pressures that I have described. In October 2013 he declared China’s intention to built ‘One Belt, One Road’. ‘One Belt’ refers to the old land route we know as the Silk Road, which begins in Xian in China and reaches all the way to Venice, Piraeus Port in Athens, Madrid and to the ports of Duisberg in Germany, Antwerp in the Netherlands and to the railway hub in Liege Belgium.

“一带一路”是丝绸之路的海上版，从中国海岸线出发，沿泰国、印度尼西亚、缅甸、孟加拉国、巴基斯坦、印度和斯里兰卡的海岸，进入中东，经西欧大陆到达西欧。苏伊士运河，然后进入地中海和大西洋。

‘One Road’ refers to the maritime version of the Silk Road, which runs from China’s coastline, along the coasts of Thailand, Indonesia, Burma, Bangladesh, Pakistan, India and Sri Lanka and into the Middle East and on to Western Europe through the Suez Canal, then into the Mediterranean and on to the Atlantic.

这听起来可能有些天马行空，但在 2015 年 2 月下旬，首列列车完成了义新欧线上 26,000 公里的往返旅程，该线从中国义乌到马德里。火车和它的八十二个集装箱花了大约两个月的时间才完成旅程，并运送了它从义乌运来的圣诞饰品，以及从马德里返回的橄榄油货物。49

This may sound fanciful, but in late February 2015 the first train completed the 26,000-kilometre round trip on the Yixin’ou line, which runs from Yiwu in China all the way to Madrid. It took the train and its eighty-two containers some two months to complete the journey and deliver the Christmas trinkets it carried from Yiwu, and the return cargo of olive oil from Madrid.49

大战略有许多重要目的。除了帮助中国获得更强大的粮食、能源和材料供应渠道外，它还将产生对中国商品和服务的需求。中国过剩的混凝土和钢材产能现在可以出售给将在这两条路线沿线建设新港口、道路、桥梁、机场等的地点。换句话说，该倡议可能让中国复制经济特区在中国国内的影响。现在他们的目标是在国外建立经济特区。

The grand strategy serves many important purposes. In addition to helping China secure stronger access to critical supplies of food, energy and materials, it will generate demand for Chinese goods and services. China’s excess capacity in concrete and steel can now be sold to the locations that will be building new ports, roads, bridges, airports and the like along these two routes. In other words, the initiative may allow China to replicate the effect Special Economic Zones had inside China. Now they aim to create Special Economic zones abroad.

亚投行

AIIB

为促进“一带一路”倡议设立了一个新机构：亚洲基础设施投资银行。它的目的是为所有这些新的发展提供资金。包括杠杆在内，亚投行的资产负债表开盘时约为 2500 亿美元，在其运营的第一天就超过了世界银行。许多国家迅速签约成为创始成员和支持者。但美国反对亚投行并责骂加入它的盟友。例如，当英国决定成为 G7 的第一个创始成员时，华盛顿的一些人对此消息感到沮丧。英国《金融时报》报道称，据报道，白宫一名匿名人士称英国正在与中国“不断迁就”，这导致了“罕见的违反”“特殊关系”。50

A new institution has been set up to facilitate the OBOR initiative: the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank. Its purpose is to finance all these new developments. Including leverage, the AIIB’s balance sheet opened at some $250 billion, which made it bigger than the World Bank on its very first day of operation. Many countries quickly signed up as founder members and supporters. But the US opposes the AIIB and has scolded allies that have joined it. For example, when Britain decided to become the first founder member from the G7, the news was greeted with dismay by some in Washington. The Financial Times reported that this resulted in a ‘rare breach’ of the ‘special relationship’ when an anonymous person in the White House was reported to have said that the UK was engaging in the ‘constant accommodation’ of China.50

有人会争辩说，中国没有钱资助这样一个宏大的计划。中国一直在流失外汇储备，尤其是在美国开始推行更高利率政策之后。一旦美国人开始名义上收紧政策，就会导致大多数新兴市场货币开始极度贬值。中国让其货币略微贬值，但它对许多货币贬值的国家失去了竞争力。俄罗斯卢布、巴西雷亚尔、南非兰特、哈萨克斯坦货币以及许多其他货币跌至历史低点。

Some will argue that China has no money to finance such a grand scheme. China has been bleeding foreign exchange reserves, especially since the US began to pursue a higher interest rate policy. Once the Americans began to nominally tighten policy it caused most emerging-market currencies to commence extremely severe devaluations. China let its currency weaken a little, but it lost competitiveness against the many countries whose currencies plummeted in value. The Russian rouble, the Brazilian real, the South African rand, the Kazakhstani currency, along with many others, fell to record lows.

这并没有阻止中国进行一些非常重大的项目，包括扩建苏伊士运河的计划。既然中国已经成为世界上沙特石油的最大买家，这是有道理的。

This has not stopped China from pursuing some very substantial projects that include plans to expand the Suez Canal. This makes sense now that China has emerged as the biggest buyer of Saudi oil in the world.

完美的圆在OBOR结束

The perfect circle ends in OBOR

亚投行标志着改变世界经济中资本流动方式和流向的坚定努力。过去，中国和其他新兴市场将其国内储蓄回收到美国、英国、欧洲和日本的主权债务中。这帮助这些国家入不敷出，因为流入的新兴市场资金弥补了这些国家支出与收入之间的差距。展望未来，资本市场将发生深刻变化，因为这些资金不再进入纸面金融资产，而是进入实体经济活动，如铁路、港口和机场。投资将涉及广泛的国家，而不仅仅是主要的工业化国家。

The AIIB marks a determined effort to change how and where capital flows in the world economy. In the past China and other emerging markets recycled their domestic savings into the sovereign debt of the US, Britain, Europe and Japan. This helped these nations live beyond their means because inbound emerging-market money financed the gap between what these nations spend and what they earn. Going forward, the capital markets will be profoundly changed as this money no longer goes into paper financial assets but into real economy activities like railways, ports and airports. The investments will be made into a wide array of countries and not just the major industrialised nations.

改革或更换

Reform or replace

“一带一路”旨在改变游戏规则。请记住，中国和其他新兴市场多年来一直在努力修复和改革现有的国际金融规则和机构，例如世界银行和国际货币基金组织。中国希望在世界银行和国际货币基金组织中有更多的代表权，特别是如果他们愿意支付更多的钱。他们希望人民币被承认为一种储备货币，将被纳入国际货币基金组织的 SDR（特别提款权）货币篮子。美国在这些和其他方面反对他们。鉴于美国的抵制，人们越来越认为改革不是一个可行的选择。更糟糕的是，人们越来越认为美国准备让该系统向自身利益倾斜。

OBOR aims to change the rules of the game. Remember that China and other emerging markets have campaigned for years to repair and reform the existing rules and institutions of international finance, such as the World Bank and the IMF. China wanted more representation in the World Bank and the IMF, especially if they were going to pay more money in. They wanted the renminbi recognised as a reserve currency that would be included in the IMF’s basket of SDR (Special Drawing Rights) currencies. The US opposed them on these and other counts. The perception has grown that reform is not a viable option, given American resistance. Worse still, the perception has grown that the US is prepared to tilt the system towards its own interests.

社会契约概念支撑着完美的循环。这个想法是，加入以美元为基础的世界经济及其机构，如世界银行、国际货币基金组织和国际贸易组织，将符合每个人的最大利益。但新兴市场现在开始质疑这一点，因为他们认为美国愿意奉行符合自身利益的政策，而不考虑国际溢出或后果。

A social contract concept underpinned the perfect circle. The idea was that membership in a US dollar-based world economy and its institutions, like the World Bank, the IMF and the International Trade Organization, would serve everyone’s best interests. But emerging markets are beginning to question this now, given what they perceive as America’s willingness to pursue policies that suit their own interests without regard for the international spillovers or consequences.

结果，中国和其他国家现在寻求取代不再为他们服务的社会契约。他们不想将储蓄重新部署到美国国债、金边债券和外滩债券等西方债务工具中，而是希望建立一种新的国际社会契约——一种更符合国内社会契约的契约。

As a result, China and others now seek to replace the social contract that has ceased to serve them. Instead of redeploying savings into Western debt instruments like Treasuries, Gilts and Bunds, they want to build a new international social contract – one that is more in keeping with the domestic social contract.

他们将要求世界以他们自己的货币与他们进行贸易，而不是被迫进入美元制度。他们将创建自己的机构和规则。他们现在将尝试以自己的方式追求自己的利益——商业、外交和军事利益。

They will ask the world to trade with them in their own currencies instead of being forced into a US dollar regime. They will create their own institutions and rules. They will try to pursue their own interests now – commercial, diplomatic and military interests – in their own way.

珍珠串

The String of Pearls

“一带一路”将不可避免地帮助中国扩大影响力，并可能在此过程中加强其军事安全。军事和战略问题不会被忽视，尽管中国会坚称这些不是他们的核心目标。要了解原因，我们需要了解美国人所说的“珍珠链”。这个绰号是 2003 年由 Booz Allen 顾问团队创造的，他们说，中国在中国境外建设一系列由中国资助和有效控制的港口的努力将有助于减少美国在重要航道上的存在所构成的威胁。51

OBOR will inevitably help China expand its influence and perhaps strengthen its military security in the process. The military and strategic issues won’t be ignored even though China will insist that these are not central objectives for them. To understand why, we need to get to grips with something the Americans refer to as the ‘String of Pearls’. This nickname was coined in 2003 by a team of Booz Allen consultants, who said Chinese efforts to build a string of ports outside China, funded and effectively controlled by China, would help diminish the threat posed by the US presence along the critical shipping lanes.51

中国的珍珠链始于海南岛，据说这里是中国建设蓝水海军的中心——即像美国一样，远离家乡，在蓝水中定位的海军。中国对许多港口都有投资和扩建计划，首先是属于缅甸的两个港口：实兑和可可群岛。后者被认为是主要针对印度的中国监听站的所在地，印度自 2005 年美印民用核协议签署以来，中国将这个国家视为美国在该地区的代理人。在此框架下，美国共享所有技术与印度建立联合防御能力。请记住，虽然美国准备与印度分享核技术，但它严格禁止向中国转让所有技术。

China’s String of Pearls begins in Hainan Island, which is said to be the centre of its efforts to build a blue-water navy – i.e., a navy like America’s, positioned far from home, in blue water. China has investments in and expansion plans for many ports, starting with two that belong to Myanmar: Sittwe and the Coco Islands. The latter are reputed to be home to a Chinese listening station that is principally aimed at India, a country China views as America’s proxy in the region, certainly since the US–India Civil Nuclear Agreement of 2005. Under this framework the US shares all technology with India and establishes joint defence capabilities. Bear in mind that while the US is prepared to share nuclear technology with India, it maintains a severe country-specific ban on all tech transfer to China. President Obama also announced a ban on the purchase of Chinese-made computer technology, based on concerns about the possibility of a Chinese cyber attack.

由于中国对印度的不信任，它正在推行在印度周边发展港口和基础设施的政策。其中包括孟加拉国吉大港和斯里兰卡汉班托塔的港口。2013 年 2 月 18 日，巴基斯坦让中国全面控制瓜多尔港口。谣言比比皆是，马尔代夫已授予中国签订了在马累建设新机场的合同。塞舌尔允许中国为其海军加油，马达加斯加和马尔代夫也有关于中国监听站的讨论。

As a result of Chinese mistrust of India, it is pursuing a policy of developing ports and infrastructure around India. These include the ports at Chittagong in Bangladesh and Hambantota in Sri Lanka. And on 18 February 2013, Pakistan gave China full operational control over the port in Gwador. Rumours abound that the Maldives has awarded the Chinese the contract to build its new airport in Malé. The Seychelles is allowing China to refuel its navy there, and there is talk of Chinese listening stations in Madagascar and the Maldives.

过去，中东对中国来说一直很困难，因为除伊朗以外的所有中东石油生产国都与美国结盟，至少直到最近。奥巴马总统与伊朗关系正常化的努力迫使中国实现利益多元化，但为了方便中国，美国设法疏远了该地区的许多其他盟友。沙特阿拉伯和以色列都因美国对利比亚叛军的支持以及阿拉伯之春期间的政权更迭而疏远。美国增加水力压裂和减少对沙特石油依赖的努力进一步损害了与沙特和该地区大多数其他统治机构的关系。美国能源独立的讨论引起了中东能源生产国的焦虑，他们意识到美国人可能不再需要他们的资产。的确，

In the past the Middle East has been difficult for China, given that all Middle Eastern oil producers except Iran were aligned with the US, at least until recently. President Obama’s efforts to normalise relations with Iran have forced China to diversify its interests but, conveniently for China, America has managed to alienate many of its other allies in the region. Both Saudi Arabia and Israel were alienated by America’s support for the rebels in Libya and regime change generally during the Arab Spring. American efforts to increase fracking and reduce dependence on Saudi oil further damaged relations with the Saudis and most other ruling houses in the region. Talk of US energy independence has led to anxiety among the energy-producing countries of the Middle East, who realise the Americans may no longer need their assets. Indeed, the US may now become a competitor in the energy markets rather than a reliable consumer.

与美国关系的结构性转变导致沙特阿拉伯在 2013 年拒绝了联合国安理会的宝贵席位，这意味着美国失去了一个安理会盟友。1983 年至 2005 年期间担任沙特驻华盛顿大使的班达尔亲王说：“这是给美国的信息，而不是给联合国的信息。”52沙特与美国关系的破裂为中国深化与中东石油生产国的外交关系打开了大门，尤其是在美国从伊拉克和阿富汗撤军的情况下，该地区的存在正在减少。

The tectonic shift in its relationship with the USA resulted in Saudi Arabia turning down a valuable seat on the UN Security Council in 2013, which meant the US lost a Security Council ally. Prince Bandar, the Saudi Ambassador to Washington from 1983–2005, said, ‘This was a message for the US, not the UN.’52 This breakdown of the Saudi-American relationship has opened the door for China to deepen diplomatic ties with Middle Eastern oil producers, especially now that the US presence in the region is diminishing, given the committed withdrawal of troops from Iraq and Afghanistan.

与此同时，中国已向东非伸出援手，正在吉布提、苏丹的苏丹港、肯尼亚的拉穆和坦桑尼亚的巴加莫约建设或扩建港口。中国实体已投资南非和西非的类似基础设施——尤其是在尼日利亚。

In the meantime, China has reached out to East Africa, where it is building or extending ports in Djibouti, at Port Sudan in Sudan, Lamu in Kenya and Bagamoyo in Tanzania. Chinese entities have invested in similar infrastructure in South Africa and West Africa – particularly in Nigeria.

最近，中国试图利用西欧的“甩卖”。希腊现金匮乏且负债累累，将其最大的港口比雷埃夫斯出售给了中国投资者，并授予了他们一些航道权。中国正在亚得里亚海港口投资，如克罗地亚的里耶卡、意大利的威尼斯、拉文纳和基奥贾，使它们能够处理新的巨型船舶，如马士基 Triple E 级，其尺寸是现有最大集装箱船的四倍. 这些巨型船舶将需要将货物运往和运出中国。

Most recently, China has sought to take advantage of the ‘fire sale’ in Western Europe. Greece, being cash poor and deeply indebted, sold its largest port, Piraeus, to Chinese investors and granted them some shipping lane rights too. China is investing in Adriatic ports such as Rijeka in Croatia, Venice, Ravenna and Chioggia in Italy, enabling them to handle the new mega-ships, such as the Maersk Triple E class, which is four times the size of the largest existing container ships. These mega-ships will be required to move goods to and from China.

此外，中国似乎租用了位于亚速尔群岛特塞拉的旧拉热斯菲尔德北约基地。53位于大西洋中部的亚速尔群岛被国防界的一些人认为与迭戈加西亚一样对中国具有重要的战略意义54代表美国。在美国人决定关闭那里的大部分基地后，葡萄牙人决定把它租给中国人。55

In addition, China appears to have leased the old Lajés Field NATO base on Terceira in the Azores.53 The Azores, lying right in the middle of the Atlantic, are considered by some in the defence community to be as strategically important for China as Diego Garcia54 is for the US. The Portuguese decided to lease it to the Chinese after the Americans decided to close large parts of the base there.55

新的伟大游戏

The New Great Game

认为中国独自在世界舞台上是一个咄咄逼人的角色是错误的，它与美国及其盟国在全球范围内与美国及其盟友展开激烈竞争。美国有自己的“珍珠链”，包括它们在日本、韩国、菲律宾、越南、澳大利亚、新西兰、迭戈加西亚、印度、阿联酋、东非部分地区以及北约控制的所有地区以及其他地区的立足点。

It would be a mistake to think that China alone is an aggressive actor on the world stage, competing nose to nose with the US and its allies for control over various locations on the global landscape. The US has its own ‘String of Pearls’ which include their footholds in Japan, Korea, the Philippines, Vietnam, Australia, New Zealand, Diego Garcia, India, the UAE, some parts of East Africa, all that NATO controls and onward.

就好像美国和中国在玩垄断游戏。每个都旨在控制或影响全球地图的某些部分。寇松勋爵，印度的英国总督在 1898 年说，国家是“棋盘上的棋子，正在上演一场争夺世界统治的伟大游戏”。他参考了彼得·霍普柯克（Peter Hopkirk）的一本畅销书《伟大的游戏》（ The Great Game，1842 年），该书记录了英国、法国、德国、俄罗斯、中国人和其他许多人为控制世界各地的领土和国家而取得的成就。奥巴马总统在 2013 年谈到叙利亚时也提到了类似的内容：

It is as if the US and China are playing a game of Monopoly. Each is aiming to control or influence parts of the global map. Lord Curzon, the British Viceroy of India, said in 1898 that countries are ‘pieces on a chessboard upon which is being played out a great game for the domination of the world’. He was making reference to a popular book by Peter Hopkirk, The Great Game (1842), which chronicled the exploits of the British, French, Germans, Russians, Chinese and many others to gain control over various territories and countries around the world. President Obama made a similar reference when he spoke about Syria in 2013:

我们不再处于冷战状态。除了人民的福祉、邻国的稳定、消除化学武器以及确保它不会成为恐怖分子的避风港之外，没有什么伟大的游戏可以赢得，美国对叙利亚也没有任何兴趣。

We are no longer in a Cold War. There’s no Great Game to be won, nor does America have any interest in Syria beyond the wellbeing of its people, the stability of its neighbours, the elimination of chemical weapons, and ensuring it does not become a safe-haven for terrorists.

相反，他说，“我相信美国在“为所有人的利益挺身而出”的能力方面是非凡的。56

Instead, he said, ‘I believe that America is exceptional’ in its ability to ‘stand up for the interests of all’.56

美国可能选择相信大博弈时代已经结束，它代表了所有人的利益，但其他人可能不同意。中国和许多新兴市场肯定不再同意。对影响力和资产的争夺仍然存在。57

It may be that the US chooses to believe the Great Game era is over and that it stands for the interests of all, but others may disagree. China and many emerging markets certainly no longer agree. There is still a scramble for influence and assets.57

和平红利的终结

The end of the peace dividend

所有国家都必须能够以合理的价格向其人民提供食物和能源，否则将面临愤怒和怨恨的风险，如果不是拒绝和革命的话。这就是迫使新兴市场参与争夺对有价值资产和供应链的控制权的原因。大多数新兴市场比中国更脆弱，因为他们缺乏追求目标的规模、资源和国家权力。然而他们必须这样做。未能保护公民免受世界经济的痛苦——通货紧缩和通货膨胀——可能导致社会动荡和政府垮台。

All nations must be able to supply food and energy to their populations at a reasonable price or risk anger and resentment, if not rejection and revolution. This is what compels emerging markets to join in the competition for control over valuable assets and supply chains. Most emerging markets are even more vulnerable than China because they lack the size, the resources and the state power to pursue their goals. And yet they must. Failure to protect citizens from the world economy’s vice of pain – the deflation and the inflation – can cause social unrest and the downfall of governments.

这就是经济力量如何为地缘政治从世界经济的边缘走向中心舞台铺平了道路。并不是任何人都想要对抗。例如，中国和美国都无法从冲突中获得任何好处。但经济力量正将两国推向更具对抗性的立场。

This is how economic forces have paved the way for geopolitics to move from the wings to centre stage across the world economy. It is not that anybody wants confrontation. Neither China nor the US, for example, have anything to gain by entering into conflict. But economic forces are driving both nations into a more confrontational stance.

考虑另一个角度。国防开支和基础设施投资可能只是另一种向经济注入资金的方式。有人说中国和西方一样负债累累。中国说西方也破产了。如果有人倾向于将战略安全问题作为支出的借口，这是否会让人感到意外？QE4（量化宽松标志四）未来会不会以国防和基础设施支出的形式出现？

Consider another angle. It is possible that defence spending and infrastructure investments are really just another way to pump money into the economy. Some say China is as indebted and broke as the West. China says the West is broke too. Should it come as any surprise then that there is an inclination to use strategic security issues as an excuse for spending? Might QE4 (quantitative easing mark four) arrive in the form of defence and infrastructure spending in future?

假设新兴市场的工人，无论是在中国还是在其他任何地方，都会不战而降地接受不断下降的生活水平，这是愚蠢的。我无法想象我们如何告诉这些工人，他们必须推迟对更美好生活、更多肉饭、在变老之前致富的梦想，直到他们变得更有生产力。这就是为什么我们应该警惕那些表明对未来失去信心和希望会引发争论、争斗和争夺稀缺资产的信号。

It would be folly to assume that emerging-market workers, whether in China or anywhere else, will accept a falling standard of living without a fight. I cannot imagine how we tell these workers that they must postpone their dreams of a better life, of more meals with meat, of becoming rich before they get old, until they become more productive. This is why we should be vigilant for signals that a loss of faith and hope in the future is provoking arguments and fights and competition for scarce assets.

似乎已经有许多信号表明，世界经济正在将和平红利转化为冲突溢价。

There seem to be many signals already that the world economy is transforming the peace dividend into a conflict premium.

 

 

1美国的一些能力可以在没有卫星引导的情况下导航和操作，但总的来说，所有现代军事装备都非常依赖电子设备。

1Some US capabilities can navigate and operate without satellite guidance, but, in the main, all modern military equipment is pretty heavily dependent on electronics one way or another.

2The US Navy stopped teaching celestial navigation in 1998, three years after GPS was introduced. In 2011 celestial navigation was reintroduced for ship navigators. The Naval Academy Class of 2017 will be tested on their ability to use a sextant.
