51Julie A. MacDonald、Amy Donahue 和 Bethany Danyluk，“亚洲能源期货”，博思艾伦，2005 年 1 月 17 日。

51Julie A. MacDonald, Amy Donahue and Bethany Danyluk, ‘Energy Futures in Asia’, Booz Allen, 17 January 2005.

52Ellen Knickmeyer，“间谍首领让沙特人与美国保持距离：班达尔王子的举动加剧了叙利亚、伊朗和埃及政策的紧张局势”，华尔街日报，2013 年 10 月 21 日。

52Ellen Knickmeyer, ‘Spy Chief Distances Saudis From US: Prince Bandar’s Move Raises Tensions Over Policies in Syria, Iran and Egypt’, Wall Street Journal, 21 October 2013.

53费利克斯·塞德勒“中国海军很快会在大西洋行动吗？” 国际海事安全中心，2013 年 2 月 8 日。

53Felix Seidler ‘Will China’s Navy Soon Be Operating in the Atlantic?’ Centre for International Maritime Security, 8 February 2013.

54迭戈加西亚是印度洋中部的小岛。美国在阿富汗和伊拉克冲突期间进行的许多轰炸行动都是从那里起飞的。

54Diego Garcia is little island in the middle of the Indian Ocean. Many of the bombing runs the US has conducted during the course of the conflicts in Afghanistan and Iraq have taken off from there.

55Julian E. Barnes，“美国和葡萄牙就亚速尔群岛美军基地的命运争执”，《华尔街日报》，2015 年 6 月 16 日。

55Julian E. Barnes, ‘US, Portugal Wrangle Over Fate of US Base in Azores’, Wall Street Journal, 16 June 2015.

56Christopher Dickey，“奥巴马的美国例外主义”，每日野兽( www.thedailybeast.com )，2013 年 9 月 24 日。

56Christopher Dickey, ‘Obama’s American Exceptionalism’, The Daily Beast (www.thedailybeast.com), 24 September 2013.

57有关新的“伟大游戏”的更多信息，请参阅 Dambisa Moyo，《赢家通吃：中国的资源竞赛及其对我们的意义》，企鹅图书，2013；Elizabeth Economy 和 Michael Levi，《无论如何：中国的资源探索如何改变世界》，牛津大学出版社，2014 年。

57For more on the new ‘Great Game’ see Dambisa Moyo, Winner Take All: China’s Race for Resources and What it Means for Us, Penguin Books, 2013; and Elizabeth Economy and Michael Levi, By All Means Necessary: How China’s Resource Quest is Changing the World, Oxford University Press, 2014.

 

 

9

9

进入地缘政治：俄罗斯、中东和石油

Enter Geopolitics: Russia, the Middle East and Oil

马克·弗格森上将是联合盟军司令部的指挥官，负责美国在欧洲和非洲的海军部队，所以当他说欧洲周围的海域现在是俄罗斯的“有争议的空间”时，这意味深长。2015 年 10 月 6 日，他创造了一个新词——“钢铁之弧”——揭示了俄罗斯与北约之间，尤其是俄罗斯与美国之间新压力的程度：

Admiral Mark Ferguson is Commander of the Joint Allied Force Command, in charge of US Navy forces in Europe and Africa, so it means something when he says that the seas around Europe are now a ‘contested space’ with Russia. On 6 October 2015 he coined a new phrase – ‘Arc of Steel’ – that reveals the extent of the new stress between Russia and NATO and more specifically between Russia and the US:

. . . 俄罗斯安全政策的重新军事化体现在从北极到地中海的“钢弧”建设中。从新的北极基地开始，到波罗的海的加里宁格勒和黑海的克里米亚，俄罗斯引进了先进的防空系统、巡航导弹系统和新平台。它还在建设将力量投射到海洋领域的能力。他们在叙利亚的基地现在让他们有机会在东地中海做同样的事情。这是一项针对北约海上力量的海上拒止战略。他们的意图是有能力使在这些地区行动的海上部队处于危险之中，从而威慑北约的行动。他们还在扩大资产的范围以从这条弧线投射电力。具体而言，俄罗斯潜艇部队的熟练程度和作战节奏正在提高。1

. . . remilitarisation of Russian security policy is evident by the construction of an ‘arc of steel’ from the Arctic to the Mediterranean. Starting at their new Arctic bases, to Kaliningrad in the Baltic, and Crimea in the Black Sea, Russia has introduced advanced air defense, cruise missile systems, and new platforms. It is also building the capability to project power into the maritime domain. Their base in Syria now gives them the opportunity to do the same in the Eastern Mediterranean. This is a sea denial strategy focused on NATO maritime forces. Their intent is to have the ability to hold at risk maritime forces operating in these areas and thus deter NATO operations. They are also expanding the reach of assets to project power from this arc. Specifically, the proficiency and operational tempo of the Russian submarine force is increasing.1

普京总统显然对美国和北约有着相似的看法。2016年1月上旬，俄罗斯发布了一份新的战略文件《关于俄罗斯联邦国家安全战略》，将美国和北约列为俄罗斯今天面临的主要国家安全威胁之一。这是自冷战结束以来，俄罗斯首次明确将美国列为战略安全威胁。

President Putin clearly has a similar view of the US and NATO. In early January 2016, Russia released a new strategy document, ‘About the Strategy of National Security of Russian Federation’ which listed the US and NATO as one of the primary national security threats Russia faces today. This was the first time since the end of the Cold War that Russia had explicitly named the US as a strategic security threat.

从那以后，情况恶化了。2016 年 2 月 12 日，俄罗斯总理德米特里·梅德韦杰夫 (Dmitry Medvedev) 表示，如果在叙利亚寻求某些选择，例如地面部队，西方将“发动一场新的世界大战”。2 2月 14 日，新闻头条援引梅德韦杰夫的话说：“我们已进入新冷战时期。” 这段恋情显然已经结束了。现在，我们需要处理好地缘政治能够自行解决的希望与俄罗斯和西方正进行正面交锋的现实之间的分离，其中包括间谍飞机、战斗机和海军舰艇的持续未遂事件。一个充满勒卡雷式间谍故事和克兰西式侵略性军事事件的时代已经开始。仅仅在几年前，暗示这可能发生似乎是可笑的。1997 年，克林顿总统成功地拥抱了俄罗斯，并吸引了 G8，让他们欢迎他们参加会议。到 2014 年，在“莫斯科吞并克里米亚”三天后，俄罗斯在愤怒的集团将其踢出之前退出了 G8。3

Things have deteriorated since then. On 12 February 2016 Russia’s Prime Minister, Dmitry Medvedev, said that the West would be ‘unleashing a new world war’ if certain options, like ground troops, were pursued in Syria.2 On 14 February, news headlines quoted Medvedev as saying ‘We have slid into a time of a new Cold War.’ The love affair is clearly over. Now we need to process the divorce between the hope that geopolitics will resolve itself and the reality that Russia and the West are engaged in nose-to-nose brinksmanship, with ongoing near misses involving spy planes, fighter jets and naval vessels. An era of Le Carré-type spy stories and Clancy-esque invasive military events on or across each other’s borders has commenced. Only a few years ago it would have seemed laughable to suggest that this could happen. In 1997 that President Clinton managed to embrace Russia and charm the G8 into welcoming them into their meetings. By 2014, three days after ‘Moscow annexed Crimea’, Russia quit the G8 before the angry group could kick them out.3

不管我们喜不喜欢，俄罗斯的观点是美国和北约正在重新武装并变得越来越咄咄逼人。他们会争辩说，美国正在利用经济和军事工具来破坏和损害俄罗斯的国家利益。如果俄罗斯的行为反映了这种观点，也就不足为奇了。

Whether we like it nor not, Russia’s view is that the US and NATO are re-arming and being increasingly aggressive. They would argue that America is using both economic and military tools to undermine and damage Russia’s national interests. It can be no surprise if Russian behaviour reflects this view.

地缘政治回归“俄罗斯阵线”并不比与中国的情况更随机。经济力量正在推动这出戏每天都在更明显地发挥作用。以下事件听起来像是好莱坞编造的——但实际上它们确实发生了。

The return of geopolitics to the ‘Russian front’ is no more random than the situation with China. Economic forces are driving the drama that is playing out more visibly every day. The following events sound like something Hollywood made up – except, they actually occurred.

间谍故事

Spy stories

2015 年底，史蒂文·斯皮尔伯格发行了《间谍之桥》，这部电影讲述了著名的间谍在柏林一座桥上交换的故事。美国人交还了俄罗斯间谍鲁道夫·阿贝尔，以换取一直从 U2 间谍飞机上监视俄罗斯的美国飞行员加里·鲍尔斯（Gary Powers）和一名被俄罗斯人视为间谍的年轻美国学生。令人着迷的是，就在这部电影于 2015 年底上映时，俄罗斯和爱沙尼亚（北约成员国）之间发生了一系列类似的事件。

In late 2015 Steven Spielberg released Bridge of Spies, a film that tells the story of the famous swap of spies over a bridge in Berlin. The Americans handed back Russian spy Rudolph Abel in exchange for the American pilot Gary Powers, who had been spying on Russia from a U2 spy plane, and a young American student whom the Russians deemed to be a spy. It was fascinating that a similar series of events was unfolding between Russia and Estonia (a NATO member) just as the film hit cinemas in late 2015.

2014 年 9 月 5 日，俄罗斯联邦安全局“抢走”了为爱沙尼亚反情报机构 Kaitsepolitsei（又名 KaPo）工作的 Eston Kohver，并将他带回莫斯科接受审讯。目前尚不清楚事件发生时科沃尔在边境的哪一边。几周后，爱沙尼亚人逮捕了两名俄罗斯人，他们被发现在爱沙尼亚境内的纳尔瓦河上“钓鱼”。两人都曾在 FSB 工作过。4最终，俄罗斯“渔民”被判入狱两个月，而爱沙尼亚政府同意用科沃尔换取爱沙尼亚特工前成员阿列克谢·德莱森，他两年前被捕并因间谍罪被监禁对于俄罗斯。在电影中的一个场景中，交换发生在一座偏远的桥上，该桥横跨皮乌萨河，连接俄罗斯和爱沙尼亚。5

On 5 September 2014 the FSB, Russia’s secret service, ‘snatched’ Eston Kohver – who worked for Estonia’s counter-intelligence agency, the Kaitsepolitsei (aka KaPo) – and took him back to Moscow for interrogation. It remains unclear which side of the border Kohver was on when it happened. A couple of weeks later the Estonians arrested two Russians who were found ‘fishing’ on the river Narva, inside Estonia’s borders; both men had formerly worked for the FSB.4 In the end the Russian ‘fishermen’ were sentenced to two months in prison, while the Estonian government agreed to trade Kohver for Alexei Dressen, a former member of the Estonian secret service who had been arrested two years earlier and imprisoned on charges of spying for Russia. In a scene straight out of the movie, the swap took place over a remote bridge that crosses the Piusa River, connecting Russia and Estonia.5

维基解密和爱德华斯诺登案件最终揭示了美国已经开始监视其所谓的盟友德国。安格拉·默克尔在东德长大，会说俄语，完全理解俄罗斯人的心态。她也完全明白如何脆弱的德国对俄罗斯能源很敏感，特别是现在德国已决定结束其核能计划，因此两国之间进行对话是有道理的。

The Wikileaks and the Edward Snowden cases ended up revealing that the US had commenced spying on its supposed ally, Germany. Angela Merkel grew up in East Germany, speaks Russian and fully understands the Russian mentality. She also fully understands how vulnerable Germany is to Russian energy, especially now that Germany has decided to end its nuclear energy programme, so it makes sense that there would be a dialogue between the two countries.

当然，盟国，甚至 G7 成员之间一直存在相互监视的情况。我父亲有很多引人入胜的故事要讲述法国人如何在这方面比俄罗斯人甚至以色列人做得更好。鉴于有关 ECHELON 监视计划的披露，该计划允许美国与英国、澳大利亚、日本和加拿大（即所谓的五眼联盟）合作监视和拦截通信，6几乎没有人不相信美国正在监视世界上发生的所有事情。

Of course it’s long been the case that allies, even G7 members, spy on each other. My father has fascinating stories to tell about how the French were better at this than the Russians or even the Israelis. Given the revelations about ECHELON surveillance programme, which permits the US to work with Britain, Australia, Japan and Canada – the so-called Five Eyes – to monitor and intercept communications,6 there can be few who don’t believe the US is spying on just about everything that goes on in the world.

围绕泄密故事的宣传意味着需要看到默克尔正在做某事。德国最终以间谍罪名驱逐了中央情报局站长，并逮捕了一名来自德国自己的情报界的双重间谍，据称他为美国人工作。总理宣布，德国情报机构 BND 将开始积极监视美国及其最亲密的情报伙伴英国。7事实上，德国领导层要求高级官员在打字机而不是电脑上准备真正敏感的文件，而在办公室播放古典音乐，以使其更难被窃听。据《南德意志报》报道，爱德华·格雷格的A小调钢琴协奏曲是热门选择。

The publicity surrounding the leaks story meant Merkel needed to be seen to be doing something. Germany ended up deporting the CIA station chief, ostensibly on spying charges, and they arrested a double agent from Germany’s own intelligence community who was allegedly working for the Americans. The Chancellor announced that the BND, Germany’s intelligence service, would commence actively spying on the US and its closest intelligence partner, Britain.7 In fact, the German leadership requires that senior officials prepare truly sensitive documents on typewriters instead of computers, while classical music is played in offices in order to make it harder to eavesdrop. According to reports in the Süddeutsche Zeitung, Edward Greig’s Piano Concerto in A minor is a popular choice.

鉴于美国在德国和整个欧洲的军事存在的全部目的是从俄罗斯保卫德国和欧洲，这可能被称为世界的地缘政治问题。

Given that the whole purpose of the US military presence in Germany and across Europe is to defend Germany and Europe from Russia, this is what might be termed a geopolitical problem for the world.

此后出现了其他间谍故事。2015 年 1 月，美国曼哈顿检察官 Preet Bharara 提出间谍指控针对两名俄罗斯政府官员和俄罗斯银行的一名雇员，热亚。巴拉拉说，“冷战结束二十多年后，俄罗斯间谍继续在秘密的掩护下在我们中间活动。”

Other spy stories have since emerged. In January 2015, the US Attorney for Manhattan, Preet Bharara, brought allegations of spying against two Russian government officials and an employee of the Russian bank, Zhenya. Bharara said, ‘More than two decades after the presumptive end of the Cold War, Russian spies continue to seek to operate in our midst under cover of secrecy.’

死亡 11 和死亡 12

Death 11 and Death 12

间谍活动并不是近年来唯一复苏的冷战活动。俄罗斯和西方也一直在进行军事对抗。

Spying isn’t the only Cold War activity to see a revival in recent years. Russia and the West have been engaged in military face offs too.

2014 年 6 月，当奥巴马总统乘坐空军一号前往日本时，一架俄罗斯 Su-27 Flanker 战斗机在一架美国间谍飞机（一架 RC-135U Combat Sent 电子情报飞机）的 100 英尺范围内飞行，某处位于美国上空。日本附近的鄂霍次克海。8五角大楼在故事泄露之前没有披露或确认该事件已经发生。当被问及为什么他们没有提到它时，五角大楼发言人说：“我还没有给你一个好的答案。”9

In June 2014, while President Obama was travelling in Air Force One en route to Japan, a Russian Su-27 Flanker fighter jet flew within 100 feet of an American spy plane (an RC-135U Combat Sent electronic intelligence plane), somewhere over the Sea of Okhotsk, near Japan.8 The Pentagon did not disclose or confirm that the event had occurred until the story leaked. When asked why they had not mentioned it, the Pentagon spokesperson said ‘I don’t have a good answer for you yet.’9

2015 年，俄罗斯轰炸机飞离加利福尼亚海岸约 10 英里，迫使 NORAD10架 F-22 战斗机紧急挥动它们离开。11事实证明，这不是一个孤立的事件。自 2002 年 4 月以来，俄罗斯军用喷气式飞机一直在侵入和侵犯其邻国的领空，当时有报道称俄罗斯熊轰炸机已飞入阿拉斯加 37 英里范围内。他们被两架美国 F-15 拦截并挥手击退。

In 2015, Russian bombers flew some ten miles off the coast of California, forcing NORAD10 to scramble F-22 fighter jets to wave them off.11 It turns out that this was not an isolated incident. Russian military jets had been breaching and violating the airspace of its neighbours since April 2002, when there were reports that Russian Bear Bombers had flown within 37 miles of Alaska. They were intercepted and waved off by two American F-15s.

2004 年 1 月，美国核动力航空母舰基蒂霍克号航空母舰的一名船员拍摄了一架熊轰炸机嗡嗡作响当航母在日本海进行演习时，小鹰号在 2,000 英尺（在击球距离之内）。2005年，一架俄罗斯战斗机在立陶宛考纳斯市附近坠毁。立陶宛、拉脱维亚、爱沙尼亚和前苏联的其他几个前成员最近才加入西方主要军事联盟北约，这让俄罗斯非常不满。北美条约组织历来是苏联的主要军事对手。

In January 2004 a crew member of the USS Kittyhawk, the nuclear-powered American aircraft carrier, filmed a Bear Bomber as it buzzed the Kittyhawk at 2,000 feet (well within hitting distance) while the carrier was on manoeuvres in the Sea of Japan. In 2005 a Russian fighter jet crashed near the city of Kaunas in Lithuania. Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia and several other former members of the former Soviet Union had only recently joined NATO, the West’s primary military alliance, much to Russia’s displeasure. The North America Treaty Organization traditionally served as the principal military opponent to the Soviet Union.

2007 年 5 月 10 日，两架俄罗斯图波列夫 Tu-95 似乎正驶入英国领空，迫使英国皇家空军从位于苏格兰的 RAF Leuchars Fife 紧急出动战斗机。后来发现，挪威空军在同一天扰乱了他们的喷气式飞机，因为熊队在前往英国的途中经过了挪威。俄罗斯人说，这次飞行是一次训练任务。

On 10 May 2007, two Russian Tupolev Tu-95s appeared to be heading into British airspace, forcing the Royal Air Force to scramble fighter jets from RAF Leuchars Fife, in Scotland. It later emerged that the Norwegian Air Force had scrambled their jets that same day because the Bears passed over Norway en route to Britain. The Russians said that the flight was a training mission.

偶尔的训练任务现在已经让位于更持久和更严肃的事情。近年来，日本出动战斗机的次数比冷战结束以来的任何时候都要多。根据官方政府统计数据，他们在 2013 年 4 月至 2014 年 4 月期间这样做了 810 次，以应对入侵。中国入侵发生415次。2014 年俄罗斯入侵发生了 359 次，2013 年发生了 248 次。据报道，2016 年 4 月中旬，俄罗斯 SU-24 对唐纳德·库克号航空母舰进行了“模拟攻击” ，它们之间仅留下 30 英尺。12

Occasional training missions have now given way to something more sustained and more serious. Japan has scrambled their fighter jets on more occasions in recent years than at any point since the end of the Cold War. According to official government statistics they did so 810 times between April 2013 and April 2014 in response to incursions. Chinese incursions occurred 415 times. Russian incursions occurred 359 times in 2014 and 248 times in 2013. In mid April 2016, it was reported that Russian SU-24s made a ‘simulated attack’ on the USS Donald Cook, leaving only thirty feet between them.12

与此同时，西方战机也一直在执行训练任务，并在意想不到的地方出现，这表明入侵和间谍问题的范围很广。2014 年 6 月上旬，两架美国 B-2 隐形轰炸机（呼叫信号为死亡 11 和死亡 12）和三架 B-52 同温层堡垒飞机抵达伦敦以西的费尔福德皇家空军基地。13业余飞机观察员很兴奋，因为这些飞机通常位于密苏里州的怀特曼空军基地，而这些战略核轰炸机在美国以外的地区极为罕见。只有在需要他们在那里时，他们才会在那里。

In the meantime, Western fighter planes have also been conducting training missions and turning up in unexpected places, which indicate that the incursion and spying issues are broad based. In early June 2014, two US B-2 Stealth bombers (with the call signals Death 11 and Death 12) and three B-52 Stratofortress aircraft arrived at the Fairford Royal Air Force Base west of London.13 Amateur plane spotters were excited because these aircraft are usually based in Missouri at Whiteman Air Force Base, and it is extremely rare for these strategic nuclear bombers to be seen outside the US. They would only be there if there were a need for them to be there.

奇怪的是，2014 年 4 月 30 日，美国联邦航空局证实，一架美国间谍飞机在洛杉矶洛杉矶国际机场上空出现，导致计算机和空中交通管制系统受到干扰，迫使 50 个航班取消，另外 455 个航班延误。14也许美国现在在加利福尼亚上空飞行间谍飞机，因为他们怀疑俄罗斯人正在从事离美国越来越近的飞行。

Strangely, on 30 April 2014, the Federal Aviation Authority confirmed that the presence of an American spy plane over LAX Airport in Los Angeles had zapped computers and scrambled air traffic control systems, forcing the cancellation of 50 flights and the delay of another 455 flights.14 Perhaps America now flies spy planes over California because they suspect that Russians are engaging in flights that are ever closer to the US themselves.

为什么？

Why?

多年来，俄罗斯军队一直在以多种方式扩大其在空中、海上和陆地上的影响力，尽管自美国开始推行量化宽松政策以来，其力度越来越大。俄罗斯人为什么这样做？

Russian forces have been expanding their reach in the air, on the sea and on land in a multitude of ways for some years, though increasingly aggressively since the US began to pursue QE. Why are the Russians doing this?

自柏林墙倒塌以来，北约不断向东扩张被俄罗斯视为明显的挑衅。从俄罗斯的角度看一看北约地图，看起来比俄罗斯近年来偶尔进行的空中入侵要糟糕得多。15美国和欧洲将北约扩大到波兰、爱沙尼亚、匈牙利、捷克共和国等前苏联卫星国的系统性努力使俄罗斯的领导层深感不安。从俄罗斯的角度来看，就好像西方“利用”了苏联不复存在和俄罗斯能够重新确立其作为核超级大国的正当立场之前的时期。仿佛美国“偷”了俄罗斯的势力范围当俄罗斯无法捍卫自己的利益时，这是一场伟大的比赛。而且不是第一次。俄罗斯的拥护者很快就说，当苏联在 1950 年代暂时处于不利地位时，总理尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫放弃了乌克兰和克里米亚。

The constant expansion of NATO eastward since the fall of the Berlin Wall is viewed by Russia as a clear provocation. A glance at a map of NATO, seen from a Russian perspective, looks much worse than the occasional air incursions undertaken by Russia in recent years.15 The systematic effort by the US and Europe to expand NATO into formerly Soviet satellite countries like Poland, Estonia, Hungary, the Czech Republic and the like has deeply unnerved Russia’s leadership. From a Russian perspective, it’s as if the West ‘took advantage’ of the period when the Soviet Union ceased to exist and before Russia was able to re-establish itself in its rightful stance as a nuclear super-power. It’s as if the US ‘stole’ Russia’s sphere of influence during a period of the Great Game when Russia could not defend its own interests. And not for the first time. Russia loyalists are quick to say that Premier Nikita Khrushchev gave up Ukraine and Crimea in a moment when the Soviet Union was briefly on the back foot in the 1950s.

事实证明，恢复俄罗斯的自豪感以及前苏联甚至前俄罗斯帝国的实际影响力在俄罗斯非常受欢迎，将弗拉基米尔普京的受欢迎程度提升到任何西方或新兴市场领导人几乎无法想象的水平.

The restoration of Russia’s pride and the physical reach of the former Soviet Union, or maybe even the former Russian Empire, has proved to be immensely popular in Russia, lifting Vladimir Putin’s popularity to levels that are almost unimaginable for any Western or emerging-market leader.

我相信当前的俄罗斯领导层确实从“伟大的游戏”的角度看待世界，并对美国没有这样做感到惊讶。人们经常听到俄罗斯人开玩笑说普京总统正在下棋，而奥巴马总统正在打高尔夫球。鉴于这种心态，我们可以开始看到俄罗斯是如何对量化宽松持怀疑态度的。对他们来说，量化宽松看起来像是美国政府为了追求内部利益而牺牲其他所有人的利益而犯下的敌对行为。俄罗斯人认为，美国为摆脱债务问题所做的努力必然会牺牲俄罗斯的利益。

I believe that the current Russian leadership do indeed view the world from a ‘Great Game’ perspective and are surprised that the US does not. One hears constant jokes from the Russians about how President Putin is playing chess while President Obama is playing golf. Given this mindset, we can begin to see how Russia came to view QE with suspicion. To them, QE looks like a hostile act committed by a US government intent on pursuing internal interests at the expense of everyone else’s. Russians believe that the efforts by the US to save themselves from the debt problem necessarily involves sacrificing Russia’s interests.

量化宽松对俄罗斯的影响，无论是在其进行中还是在解除后，都是显着的，并且在两个方向上都相当负面。不仅如此，它还改变了“伟大游戏”中的资产价值。如果美国正在输出通货膨胀或导致世界经济通货膨胀的条件，那么俄罗斯人认为他们应该准备好利用资产价值的变化。这样看来，我们可能会问，在美国货币政策占主导地位、北约扩张的世界里，乌克兰、波罗的海、地中海或叙利亚对俄罗斯有什么价值？

The impact of QE on Russia, as it proceeded and as it is unwound, is significant and quite negative in both directions. More than that, it changes the value of assets in the ‘Great Game’. If America is exporting inflation, or conditions that give rise to inflation in the world economy, then Russians think they should be ready to take advantage of the changed value of assets. Seen this way, we might ask what is the value of Ukraine or the Baltic or the Mediterranean or Syria to Russia in a world where American monetary policy dominates and NATO expands?

乌克兰和克里米亚

Ukraine and Crimea

围绕乌克兰和克里米亚有许多相互竞争的叙述。这是一种“他说，她说”的情况。显而易见的是，到 2013 年和 2014 年，乌克兰显然存在无法偿还的债务问题，其中债务与 GDP 的比率如此之大，以至于扼杀了所有的增长前景。在克里米亚事件发生之前，乌克兰的食品价格和能源价格已经上涨了近三年。长期以来，人们一直怀疑，当时的乌克兰总统、俄罗斯的亲密盟友维克托·亚努科维奇一直在人为地压低通胀数据，试图掩盖生活成本的上行压力。当时估计乌克兰人仅在食品上就花费了超过 50% 的收入。由于紧缩，许多乌克兰人开始提出重要的社会契约问题：“为什么我的社会中的财富会流向别人而不是我？”

There are many competing narratives around Ukraine and Crimea. It’s a ‘he said, she said’ kind of situation. What is clear is that by 2013 and 2014 it was obvious that Ukraine had an unpayable debt problem, with a debt-to-GDP ratio so large it was killing all prospects of growth. Food prices and energy prices in Ukraine had been rising for nearly three years in advance of the events in Crimea. It was long suspected that the then President of Ukraine, Viktor Yanukovych, a close ally of Russia, had been artificially suppressing the inflation data, trying to mask the upward pressure in the cost of living. At the time it was estimated that Ukrainians were spending more than 50 per cent of their income on food alone. As a result of the squeeze, many Ukrainians began to ask that important social contract question: ‘Why is the wealth in my society going to someone else and not to me?’

对于一些人来说，答案在于推动看似俄罗斯支持的总统亚努科维奇下台，并与欧盟更紧密地结盟。欧盟鼓励这样做。对于其他人，例如克里米亚的大多数公民，解决方案在于推动从乌克兰独立并与俄罗斯更紧密地结盟。俄罗斯人鼓励这样做。无论长期的忠诚是什么，经济压力都会导致或迫使人们选边站队。到 2014 年 2 月，乌克兰、克里米亚和俄罗斯的公民计算了他们的地缘政治利益，并得出结论认为值得做出改变。一些乌克兰人推动加入欧盟。克里米亚讲俄语的公民开始了一场分离主义运动，他们希望以独立结束。俄罗斯自然而然地开始支持分离的亲俄分裂分子——毕竟乌克兰欠俄罗斯一大笔债务，因此违约对俄罗斯来说将是痛苦的。不过，风险远不止于此。

For some the answer lay in pushing the seemingly Russian-backed President, Yanukovych, out of power and moving towards a closer alignment with the European Union. The EU encouraged this. For others, such as the majority of citizens in Crimea, the solution lay in pushing for independence from Ukraine and closer alignment with Russia. The Russians encouraged that. Whatever longstanding allegiances had been in place, the economic pressures caused, or forced, people to choose sides. By February 2014, the citizens of Ukraine, Crimea and Russia had calculated their geopolitical interests and concluded it was worth making changes. Some Ukrainians pushed for EU membership. The Russian-speaking citizens in Crimea began a separatist movement that they hoped would end in independence. Russia naturally began to support the breakaway pro-Russian separatists – after all, Ukraine owed a good deal of its debt to Russia, so a default would be painful for Russia. More than that was at stake though.

确定地缘政治事件的开始总是很困难，但当欧盟邀请乌克兰加入其成员国时，俄罗斯的领导层感到面临着一个极其重要的地缘政治问题——安全。俄罗斯不希望欧盟或北约控制一个不仅位于其边境而且拥有如此多真正有价值资产的国家。

It is always difficult to pinpoint the start of a geopolitical event, but when the EU invited Ukraine to join its membership, Russia’s leadership felt confronted by a singularly important geopolitical issue – security. Russia did not want the EU or NATO to gain control over a country that was not only on their border but which contained so many genuinely valuable assets.

俄罗斯驻英国大使亚历山大·雅科文科曾问我：“你们美国人完全忘记了古巴人吗？导弹危机？换句话说，你没看出这是多么的挑衅吗？我的回答是，‘是的。我们完全忘记了古巴导弹危机。16我们忘记了美国在 1962 年受到俄罗斯企图在古巴部署核武器的威胁，而我们西方有时无法理解（甚至不希望）欧盟内部的乌克兰也可能是北约内部的乌克兰。因此，我们无法理解，在其边境可能面临北约核武器对俄罗斯来说，就像在古巴导弹危机期间对美国一样是不可接受的。

The Russian Ambassador to the UK, Alexander Yakovenko, once asked me, ‘Have you Americans completely forgotten about the Cuban Missile Crisis?’ In other words, do you not see how provocative this is? My answer was, ‘Yes. We have completely forgotten about the Cuban Missile Crisis.’16 We have forgotten that America was threatened by Russia’s attempt to place nuclear weapons in Cuba in 1962 and we, in the West, sometimes fail to appreciate (or even desire) that a Ukraine inside the EU would also likely be a Ukraine inside NATO. We therefore cannot grasp that potentially facing NATO nuclear weapons on its border would be as unacceptable for Russia as it was for America during the Cuban Missile Crisis.

还有更多。除了保留对北约的缓冲之外，我怀疑俄罗斯领导人也意识到克里米亚最有价值的资产是粮食和能源。乌克兰是前苏联的粮仓，也是世界上最大的粮食生产国之一。它拥有世界上任何国家中最高浓度的黑色表土，约占世界供应量的 30%。它也是世界上最大的化肥生产商之一。如果您怀疑通货膨胀即将来临，那么所有这些都具有真正的价值。事实证明，俄罗斯人的恐惧是正确的。在撰写本文时，俄罗斯的通货膨胀率正在急剧上升。这是基于 2015 年官方增长 13% 的结果，这可能严重低估了真实情况。如果俄罗斯人面临更高的食品价格，这很重要。

There is more though. Beyond preserving a buffer against NATO, I suspect that Russia’s leaders also appreciated that the most valuable assets in Crimea are food and energy. Ukraine is the breadbasket of the former Soviet Union and one of the largest producers of food in the world. It has the highest concentration of black topsoil of any nation in the world, which amounts to some 30 per cent of the world’s supply. It is one of the world’s largest fertiliser producers as well. All this has real value if you suspect that inflation is coming your way. The Russians have been proved right in their fear. At the time of writing, Russian inflation is dramatically increasing. That’s on the back of an official increase of 13 per cent in 2015, which probably seriously understates the true situation. It matters if Russians face much higher food prices.

此外，乌克兰是俄罗斯供应西欧的天然气管网的中心点。在维克托·亚努科维奇掌权期间，俄罗斯人为地补贴了天然气价格，但威胁说如果他被赶下台就会提高价格。这只是提高了对俄罗斯依赖的意识。有一次，作为抗议活动的一部分，反对亚努科维奇和俄罗斯的乌克兰人联盟——迈丹人民联盟宣布取消与俄罗斯签订的所有天然气合同的 85%。当然，没有其他供应来源，所以威胁是空洞的。但是行动提高了俄罗斯对其脆弱性的认识。谁控制了管道通过的土地，谁就拥有真正的权力。如果您可以避免被拖欠，这就是真正的力量。因此，我们看到商品价格压力成为世界冲突根源的另一个例子。

In addition, Ukraine is the centre point of Russia’s natural gas pipeline network, which supplies Western Europe. Russia artificially subsidised gas prices while Viktor Yanukovych was in power, but threatened to raise prices if he were to be thrown out. This merely heightened awareness of the dependency on Russia. At one point, as part of the protest, the Maidan People’s Union – an alliance of Ukrainians opposed to Yanukovych and Russia – announced it was cancelling 85 per cent of all the natural gas contracts with Russia. Of course, there was no alternative source of supply, so the threat was hollow. But the action heightened Russia’s awareness of its vulnerability. Whoever controls the land the pipelines pass through has real power. It is real power if you can avoid being defaulted upon. And so we see another example of price pressures around commodities becoming a source of conflict in the world.

其他战略利益和资产也受到威胁。自十八世纪后期以来，乌克兰的塞瓦斯托波尔一直是俄罗斯唯一或主要的温水港口，当时它成为俄罗斯黑海舰队的所在地。2009 年，乌克兰宣布与俄罗斯的租约将于当年 12 月 13 日结束。这恰逢叙利亚局势恶化。为什么这很重要？好吧，俄罗斯唯一的其他温水港口位于拉塔基亚和塔尔图斯。17到 2013 年 6 月，俄罗斯已将其人员从叙利亚的这些港口撤离，使其别无其他温水港口选择。18鉴于叙利亚港口的丧失，塞瓦斯托波尔必须具有新的意义。

Other strategic interests and assets were at stake too. Sevastopol in Ukraine had been Russia’s only or principal warm-water port since the late eighteenth century, when it became the home of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet. In 2009 Ukraine had announced the lease with Russia would come to an end by 13 December that year. This happened to coincide with the deterioration of stability in Syria. Why was that relevant? Well, Russia’s only other warm-water ports were located there, in Latakia and Tartus.17 By June 2013, Russia had evacuated its personnel from these ports in Syria, leaving it with no other warm-water port options.18 Sevastopol must have taken on new significance in light of the loss of the ports in Syria.

当维克多·亚努科维奇政府于 2013 年 11 月 21 日驳回乌克兰加入欧盟的努力时，Maidan 联盟开始抗议，然后反抗，起初缓慢，但力量不断增加。到 2014 年 2 月 22 日，亚努科维奇已经逃离该国。到 2014 年 2 月 27 日，枪手已经开始控制克里米亚。然后，在 3 月的第一周，没有标记的部队（一些人声称他们来自俄罗斯第 76 突击部队，另一些人声称他们是当地的准军事人员）实际控制了港口、机场和克里米亚地区议会最高拉达. 2014 年 3 月 6 日，克里米亚宣布成为一个新国家。

When Viktor Yanukovych’s government dismissed the effort to have Ukraine join the EU on 21 November 2013, the Maidan alliance began to protest and then revolt, slowly at first but with ever increasing force. By 22 February 2014 Yanukovych had fled the country. By 27 February 2014 gunmen had begun to take control of Crimea. Then, in the first week of March, unmarked troops (some claimed they were from Russia’s 76th Shock Troops unit, others claim they were local paramilitaries), took physical control over the ports, the airports and the regional parliament in Crimea, the Verkhovna Rada. On 6 March 2014 Crimea declared itself a new state.

根据 2014 年 5 月上旬出现的新闻报道，俄罗斯进行了一次出人意料的模拟“大规模报复性核打击”四月中旬，就在克里米亚局势升温之际。19他们显然从北方和太平洋舰队内的两艘核潜艇发射了无武器洲际弹道导弹（通常携带核武器），并从大天使附近的普列谢茨克航天发射场发射了一艘 RS-24 Yars，击中了堪察加的目标。

According to press reports that emerged in early May 2014, Russia had engaged in a surprise simulated ‘massive retaliatory nuclear strike’ in mid April, just as things were heating up in Crimea.19 They apparently launched weaponless ICBMs (which usually carry nuclear weapons) from two nuclear submarines within the Northern and Pacific Fleets and one RS-24 Yars from the Plesetsk Cosmodrome near Archangel, which hit its target in Kamchatka.

是什么促使了这些行动？我回到这本书的中心原则。债务问题与通胀压力相结合，造成了社会压力。债务导致各方对乌克兰的未来失去信心。在乌克兰陷入巨额债务并失去管理内部事务的能力后，当地的俄罗斯族人希望分离主义运动能够成功，因为他们对自己的国家失去了信心。非俄罗斯民众更愿意与欧盟结盟，但这对俄罗斯来说是不可接受的，最终对欧盟本身来说也是负担不起的。由于欧盟内部，尤其是欧元区内的所有债务问题，没有人有任何现金来救助乌克兰。俄罗斯人拒绝让乌克兰或该国的任何部分拖欠其债务。

What prompted these actions? I come back to a central tenet of this book. The debt problem, combined with inflation pressure, created social pressures. Debt resulted in a loss of faith in the future of Ukraine that was felt on all sides. The local ethnic Russian population wanted the separatist movement to succeed due to their loss of faith in their state after Ukraine fell into overwhelming debt and lost the capacity to manage its internal affairs. The non-Russian population preferred an alignment with the EU, but this was unacceptable to Russia and, ultimately, unaffordable to the EU itself. With all the debt trouble within the EU and especially within the Eurozone, no one had any cash to bail out Ukraine. The Russians refused to allow Ukraine or any part of that nation to default on its debt.

涉及的资产价值不断上升。所涉及的各种社会契约显然都在打破，包括国际社会契约。俄罗斯没有奉行保护国际金融体系所有参与者利益的政策，而是认为美国已经开始以牺牲其他所有人为代价来追求自己的利益。在美国（通过英国）建议制裁应包括将俄罗斯排除在全球金融和银行网络之外之后尤其如此。这些狭隘、具体和痛苦的金融制裁导致俄罗斯对国际金融体系的忠诚度降低，在量化宽松政策改变资产价值之际，该体系不再为他们的利益服务。这鼓励俄罗斯声称拥有实际领土并扩大影响力。

The value of the assets involved was rising. The various social contracts involved were clearly breaking, including the international social contract. Instead of pursuing a policy of protecting the interests of all participants in the international financial system, Russia felt America had begun to pursue its own interest at everyone else’s expense. This was especially true after the US (via Britain) suggested that sanctions should include excluding Russia from global financial and banking networks. These narrow, specific and painful financial sanctions caused Russia to feel less allegiance to an international financial system that was no longer serving their interests at a time when QE was changing the value of assets. This encouraged Russia to claim physical territory and to expand influence.

SWIFT 和万事达卡

SWIFT and Mastercard

2014年10月，针对俄罗斯涉嫌介入乌克兰，美国提出多项金融制裁措施。英国建议将俄罗斯踢出 SWIFT，即全球银行间金融电信协会，该协会是全球银行支付系统的核心基础设施。如果没有访问权限，俄罗斯的资金就无法转入或转出该国。20作为制裁的一部分，美国还鼓励 Visa 和万事达卡停止处理俄罗斯交易。21俄罗斯的回应是说美国和英国不能双管齐下。它不能指望美元成为将国际金融体系凝聚在一起的粘合剂，然后将其用作捍卫自己狭隘国家利益的枪。

In October of 2014, in response to Russia’s alleged involvement in Ukraine, the US proposed a number of financial sanctions. The UK suggested that Russia could be kicked out of SWIFT, the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunications, which is core infrastructure of the global bank payments system. Without access, Russian money could not be transferred in or out of the country.20 The US also encouraged Visa and Mastercard to stop processing Russian transactions as part of the sanctions.21 The Russian response was to say the US and the UK cannot have it both ways. It cannot expect the US dollar to be the glue that holds the international financial system together and then use it as a gun to defend their own narrow national interests.

去美元化

De-dollarising

由于美国看似糟糕或不公平的管理，俄罗斯和中国都希望使世界经济“去美元化”，并增加以人民币和卢布进行的贸易额。他们也有经济政策举措来削弱美国在这一领域的实力。例如，2014 年 5 月，俄罗斯和中国领导人签署了一项名为《合作协议》的协议，该协议鼓励两国绕过美元，越来越多地以本国货币进行交易。2014 年 6 月，他们签署了中俄协议，这是世界上最大的天然气交易。其部分目的是鼓励仅使用卢布和人民币支付天然气费用，并鼓励俄罗斯和中国制定自己的天然气基准并以本国货币定价。

Both Russia and China want to ‘de-dollarise’ the world economy and increase the amount of trade that occurs in renminbi and roubles as a result of America’s seemingly poor or unfair stewardship. They too have economic policy initiatives to undermine America’s power in this arena. As examples, in May of 2014, Russia and China’s leaders signed a deal, the Agreement of Cooperation, which encouraged both countries to bypass the US dollar and transact increasingly in their own currencies. In June 2014 they signed the China–Russia Agreement, the biggest gas deal ever done in the world. Part of its purpose was to encourage the use of only roubles and renminbi to pay for gas, and for Russia and China to create their own natural gas benchmarks and pricing in their own currencies.

'普遍的命令'

‘Universal Diktat’

2014 年 10 月 24 日，普京总统在索契的瓦尔代讨论俱乐部发表演讲，他警告世界他将挑战他所谓的美国“普遍命令”，他的意思是美元主导的世界秩序：

On 24 October 2014 President Putin gave a speech at the Valdai Discussion Club in Sochi in which he warned the world he was going to challenge what he called America’s ‘Universal Diktat’, by which he meant the US dollar-led world order:

首先，世界秩序的变化——以及我们今天看到的这种规模的事件——通常伴随着如果不是全球战争和冲突，那么伴随着一系列密集的地方层面的冲突。其次，全球政治首先是关于经济领导力。

First of all, changes in the world order – and what we are seeing today are events on this scale – have usually been accompanied by if not global war and conflict, then by chains of intensive local-level conflicts. Second, global politics is above all about economic leadership.

“这不是我们开始的，”他继续说，但如果美国继续走这条路，各州“将遭受极大的困难，甚至可能彻底毁灭”。

‘We did not start this,’ he went on, but if the US continued on this path states ‘would be subjected to extreme hardship, or perhaps even total destruction’.

通过提到核武器，普京提请注意俄罗斯最近增加了对核导弹和高超音速导弹的测试。在演讲后的几天内，北约立即被迫对大约 26 起俄罗斯喷气式飞机和轰炸机在 48 小时内发生的空中入侵事件做出回应。这也意味着作为一个信号。

By invoking a reference to nuclear weapons, Putin drew attention to Russia’s increased testing of nuclear and hypersonic missiles in the recent past. Within a few days of the speech, NATO was promptly compelled to respond to some twenty-six reported air incursions by Russian jets and bombers, which occurred over a forty-eight-hour period. That too is meant to serve as a signal.

俄罗斯总理梅德韦杰夫也就SWIFT问题发表了重要讲话。他说，“我们将关注事态发展，如果做出这样的决定，我想指出，我们的经济反应和一般任何其他反应都将不受限制。”22

The Russian Prime Minister, Dmitry Medvedev, also made an important statement on the SWIFT issue. He said, ‘We’ll watch developments and if such decisions are made, I want to note that our economic reaction and generally any other reaction will be without limits.’22

当我阅读俄罗斯官方通讯社 ITAR-TASS 报道的这份声明时，我以为他的意思是俄罗斯可以通过威胁核武器来应对 SWIFT 问题。我问我在五角大楼的朋友他们是怎么想的。他们说‘什么是迅速？' 总的来说，美军并没有意识到这个市场问题。当我问金融市场的交易员他们认为梅德韦杰夫先生是什么意思时，他们认为他的意思是俄罗斯会削弱美元作为储备货币的地位。这解释了俄罗斯努力与中国结盟并推动建立一个贸易以人民币或卢布或美元以外的任何货币定价的世界。

When I read this statement, which was reported by ITAR-TASS, Russia’s official news agency, I assumed he meant that Russia could respond to the SWIFT issue by threatening nuclear weapons. I asked my friends at the Pentagon what they thought. They said ‘What is SWIFT?’ In the main, the US military were unaware of this market issue. When I asked traders in the financial markets what they thought Mr Medvedev meant, they assumed he meant that Russia would undermine the US dollar as a reserve currency. This explains Russia’s efforts to align with China and push for a world where trade would be priced in renminbi or roubles or any currency other than US dollars.

俄罗斯加紧积累黄金的努力也反映了这一点。他们追求黄金储备的假设是未来美元会贬值，而卢布也可能贬值。23卢布在 2016 年初跌至历史最低点后，这些黄金购买开始变得更有意义。

Russia’s intensified efforts to accumulate gold reflect this as well. They have pursued gold reserves on the assumption that US dollars would be worth less in future and that the rouble might be worth less too.23 Once the rouble collapsed to its lowest value ever in early 2016, these gold purchases began to make more sense.

核武器可能重新回到谈判桌上的想法被嘲笑为荒谬的想法而被抛弃。然而，这似乎正是发生的事情。俄罗斯越来越多地试图威胁使用核武器。

The notion that nuclear weapons could be back on the negotiating table was scoffed at and cast aside as a ridiculous notion. And yet, that seems to be exactly what has happened. Russia has increasingly sought to threaten the use of nuclear weapons.

当然，他们的观点是美国和北约挑起了这个。从冷战结束到 2012 年，美国一直在系统地退役并将其在欧洲的核能力削减约 90%。在那一年，奥巴马总统开始扭转这一进程，宣布升级 B61 战术核武器仍然使它们更“可用”。24此后，美国加强并升级了其在欧洲的核存在。

Of course, their view is that the US and NATO provoked this. The US had been systematically decommissioning and drawing down nuclear capabilities by about 90 per cent in Europe from the end of the Cold War until 2012. In that year, President Obama began to reverse that process by announcing an upgrade of the B61 tactical nuclear weapons that remained to make them more ‘usable’.24 Since then the US has intensified and upgraded its nuclear presence in Europe.

博恩霍尔姆

Bornholm

因此，考虑到这一切，如果其他有价值的资产以及俄罗斯对它们的兴趣只停留在乌克兰和克里米亚，那就太奇怪了。美国和整个西方普遍持有的观点是，整个俄罗斯的故事都是关于乌克兰的。但是，对于俄罗斯来说，乌克兰只是新的“伟大博弈”的一部分。

So, considering all this, it would be strange if other valuable assets, and Russia’s interest in them, stopped with Ukraine and Crimea. The commonly held view in the US and across the West had been that the whole Russia story was about Ukraine. But, for Russia, Ukraine is merely one part of the new ‘Great Game’.

2014年夏天，波罗的海似乎发生了一件有趣的事情。俄罗斯人在波罗的海举行了冷战以来最大规模的海军演习。当时，与我交谈过的美国人和北约成员国开玩笑说，俄罗斯的船只会在出海途中沉没，还是在返航途中沉没。但大约在那个时候，几乎在斯德哥尔摩市中心发现了一艘身份不明的“外国”潜艇。人们普遍认为，无论对错，它是一艘俄罗斯船只。后来，瑞典否认它是一艘潜艇。

An interesting incident seems to have occurred in the Baltic in the summer of 2014. The Russians held the largest naval exercises in the Baltic since the Cold War. At the time, the Americans and NATO members I spoke to joked about whether Russia’s ships would sink on the way out or on the way back. But at about that time, there were sightings of an unidentified ‘foreign’ submarine practically in the middle of Stockholm. It was widely assumed, rightly or wrongly, to be a Russian vessel. Later, Sweden denied that it was a submarine at all.

随后，丹麦情报部门 DDIS 发表声明称，他们截获了来自波罗的海的俄罗斯船只的加密通信，表明俄罗斯“模拟”了对波罗的海中部大岛博恩霍尔姆的物理攻击海。碰巧，所谓的袭击发生在丹麦政界人士聚集在那里参加年度会​​议的那一周。

Then the DDIS, the Danish Intelligence service, released a statement saying that they had intercepted encrypted communications from Russian vessels in the Baltic indicating that Russia had ‘simulated’ a physical attack on Bornholm, a large island that sits smack in the middle of the Baltic Sea. It happened that the alleged attack occurred during the very week that Danish politicians were gathered there for an annual conference.

这给美国、欧洲和北约带来了许多问题。如果俄罗斯真的想控制波罗的海，它能以多快的速度实实在在地控制？自冷战结束以来，波罗的海上没有人在国防上花过任何钱，这可能用不了多久。和平红利将所有支出转移到其他活动上。

This raised many issues for the US, Europe and NATO. How quickly could Russia take physical control of the Baltic if it really wanted to? It might not take long since no one on the Baltic had spent any money on defence since the end of the Cold War. The peace dividend shifted all that expenditure to other activities.

北约会保卫丹麦吗？最初的回答是“当然，是的”。根据第 5 条，北约有义务保护任何成员免受攻击。然而，每个人都知道美国（和/或其总统）已经筋疲力尽，鉴于中东局势紧张，无法进行另一场重大对抗。美国人真的愿意花更多的资源来保卫一个他们无法在地图上标注的国家吗？25

Would NATO defend Denmark? The initial reply was ‘of course, yes’. NATO is obligated under Article 5 to defend any member against attack. However, everyone knows the US (and/or its president) is exhausted and not in a position to pursue another major confrontation given the draining situation in the Middle East. Would Americans really want to spend more resources defending a nation they could not place on a map?25

无论如何，为什么要针对博恩霍尔姆？要想找到答案，只需看看岛上的位置，波罗的海，那里有大量的供应鱼和蛋白质。随着俄罗斯通货膨胀的上升，获得这些关键商品至关重要。换个角度来看，到 2016 年 1 月，4.5 公斤挪威鲑鱼（相当于一条鱼）的价值超过了一桶油。26该岛还位于西欧重要航道的中间。可能相关的是，2014 年俄罗斯宣布放弃允许立陶宛检查加里宁格勒的武器，包括核武器的协议。加林格勒是位于波罗的海波兰和立陶宛之间的飞地，距离博恩霍尔姆和丹麦不远。

In any case, why target Bornholm? For an answer, one might need look no further than the island’s location, the Baltic, with its vast supply of fish and protein. With Russian inflation rising, access to these critical commodities is essential. To put it in perspective, by January 2016 the value of 4.5kg of Norwegian salmon (equivalent to a single fish) was worth more than one barrel of oil.26 The island also sits in the middle of critical shipping lanes for Western Europe. It might be relevant that in 2014 Russia announced it was abandoning the agreement that permitted Lithuania to inspect Kaliningrad for weapons, including nuclear weapons. Kalingrad is the enclave nestled between Poland and Lithuania on the Baltic Sea, which sits not very far from Bornholm and Denmark.

或者丹麦岛之所以成为目标，是因为当时的北约首脑是丹麦人，这使它成为一个高价值的目标。还碰巧的是，丹麦正在考虑使用其舰队来增强其导弹防御系统的北约雷达。俄罗斯通过威胁将核武器瞄准丹麦船只来应对这种可能性。27

Or perhaps the Danish island was targeted because the head of NATO at that time was a Dane, which made it a high-value target. It also happened that Denmark was considering using its fleet to enhance NATO’s radar for their missile defence system. Russia responded to that possibility by threatening to aim nuclear weapons at Danish ships.27

我不想一一列举俄罗斯和北约之间发生的各种事件28但累积效应是双方都对彼此越来越警惕。29他们可能在许多可能的地方发生冲突和对抗。

I don’t want to list all the various incidents that have occurred between Russia and NATO28 but the cumulative effect is that both sides are increasingly wary of one another.29 They can come into conflict and confrontation in many possible places.

钢铁之弧

The Arc of Steel

因此，就像中国的“珍珠链”一样，俄罗斯的“钢弧”是一系列战略位置，人们可以在地图上看到。让我们看看竞争性国家利益日益明显的地方。

So, like China’s ‘String of Pearls’, Russia’s ‘Arc of Steel’ is a line-up of strategic locations that one can see on a map. Let’s have a look at the locations where competing national interests are increasingly apparent.

北极

The Arctic

据估计，北极拥有世界上多达 13% 的未发现石油和 30% 以上的可用天然气，这可以解释为什么据报道梅德韦杰夫总理称其为“资源圣地”。副总理德米特里·罗戈宗于 2015 年 4 月 20 日在斯瓦尔巴群岛附近短暂降落在挪威，但没有提醒挪威人注意他的存在，这一点得到了回应。他在推特上写道：“北极是俄罗斯的麦加”。挪威人立即召见了俄罗斯大使进行了一次整容。

It is estimated the Arctic holds as much as 13 per cent of the world’s undiscovered oil and more than 30 per cent of the available natural gas, which would explain why Prime Minister Medvedev is reported to have called it the ‘Mecca of resources’. This was echoed when Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Rogozon briefly landed in Norway, near Svalbard, on 20 April 2015, without having alerted the Norwegians to his presence. He tweeted: ‘The Arctic is Russian Mecca’. The Norwegians promptly summoned the Russian Ambassador for a dressing down.

俄罗斯对北极的兴趣由来已久。2007 年 8 月，俄罗斯派出一艘和平号潜艇进入北极极地冰盖之下。从那艘船上，俄罗斯在分隔北冰洋的罗蒙诺索夫海脊的海床上，在海平面以下危险的 14,000 英尺处插上了一面钛制的俄罗斯国旗，以象征他们声称北极大部分地区属于俄罗斯。随后，普京总统在一艘核动力破冰船的船头发表了讲话。他说，他预计俄罗斯 20% 至 25% 的国内生产总值将来自极其丰富的北极资源，包括石油、天然气、矿产、黄金、镍甚至钻石。俄罗斯随后成立了一个新的联邦安全部门，部署专门为北极作战训练的特种部队突击队员。

There is a long history to Russia’s interest in the Arctic. In August 2007 Russia sent a Mir submarine to go underneath the polar ice cap in the Arctic. From that vessel, Russia planted a titanium Russian flag a perilous 14,000 feet below the surface on the seabed of the Lomonosov Ridge, which divides the Arctic Ocean, to symbolise their claim that much of the Arctic belongs to Russia. Subsequently, President Putin gave a speech on the bow of a nuclear-powered icebreaker. He said that he expected some 20–25 per cent of Russian GDP to come from the incredibly rich Arctic resources, including oil, gas, minerals, gold, nickel and even diamonds. Russia subsequently established a new division of the Federal Security Service to deploy Special Forces commandos specifically trained for Arctic fighting.

一段时间以来，挪威一直担心俄罗斯会简单地对该国部分地区进行物理控制，这些地区既不设防，也可能由于地形的偏远和寒冷而无法防御。这说明——也许是一个信号——挪威也宣布成立一支由突击队伞兵组成的北极部队，受过训练以保护和捍卫其北极利益。它还将其军事指挥总部从斯塔万格迁至北极圈内的博德，该地点最初建于冷战时期，旨在抵御俄罗斯的核攻击。

Fears have been accelerating for some time in Norway that Russia would simply take physical control of parts of the country which are both undefended and perhaps indefensible, given the remote and cold nature of the terrain. It is telling – a signal, perhaps – that Norway too announced the creation of an Arctic corps of commando paratroopers, trained to protect and defend its Arctic interests. It has also moved its military command headquarters from Stavanger to Bodø, a location inside the Arctic Circle, which was originally built in the Cold War and designed to withstand a Russian nuclear attack.

挪威积极反对中国成为北极理事会观察员，支持俄罗斯打造“北极”群力”。自 2006 年以来，挪威在所谓的“高北地区”举行了一场名为“冷反应”的军事演习，因为在声称拥有北极领土的五个国家中有四个是北约成员国：美国、加拿大、挪威和丹麦。芬兰和瑞典也加入了进来。但是，不知何故，尽管成为北极突击队需要非凡的训练和技能，但挪威似乎不太可能在北极保持足够强大的立足点，以防止俄罗斯和中国首先开发该领土。这就是为什么挪威人发射了一艘价值 2.5 亿美元的北极间谍船Marjata，在 2014 年。据挪威情报部门负责人 Kjell Grandhagen 中将称，“我们的政治领导层要求描述该地区正在发生的事情”，以及“能够捍卫这一点的军事方面。 '30

Norway actively opposes China’s efforts to become an observer on the Arctic Council and supports Russia’s efforts to create an ‘Arctic Group of Forces’. Since 2006, Norway has held a military exercise called Cold Response in what it calls ‘the High North’, since four of the five countries that claim Arctic territory are NATO members: the US, Canada, Norway and Denmark. Finland and Sweden join in as well. But, somehow, despite the extraordinary training and skill required to be an Arctic commando, it does not seem likely that Norway will be able keep a strong enough foothold on the Arctic to prevent Russia and China from exploiting the territory first. This is why the Norwegians launched a $250-million Arctic spy boat, the Marjata, in 2014. According to the Head of Norwegian Intelligence, Lieutenant General Kjell Grandhagen, ‘There is a demand from our political leadership to describe what is going on in this region,’ and ‘military aspects in terms of being able to defend that.’30

另一个明显的信号是，2015 年 10 月放映了一部根据惊悚片作家乔·内斯博（Jo Nesbø）的想法改编的挪威电视连续剧《占领》。有史以来最昂贵的挪威电视节目，它讲述了俄罗斯秘密收购挪威石油和能源资产的故事（在欧盟的默许和美国退出北约的情况下）。俄国人被深深地冒犯了。俄罗斯驻挪威大使说：

In another telling signal, October 2015 saw the screening of Occupied, a Norwegian television series based on an idea by thriller writer Jo Nesbø. The most expensive Norwegian TV programme ever made, it tells the story of a stealthy takeover of Norway’s oil and energy assets by Russia (with the tacit approval of the EU and as a result of America’s withdrawal from NATO). The Russians were deeply offended. The Russian Ambassador to Norway said:

这绝对是非常遗憾的。. . 第二次世界大战胜利 70 周年，该系列的作者——仿佛他们忘记了苏联军队在从纳粹占领者手中解放挪威北部的英勇贡献——决定以最糟糕的冷战传统来吓唬挪威人来自东方的不存在威胁​​的观众。

It’s definitely very regrettable that in the . . . 70th anniversary of the victory of World War II, the authors of the series – as if they had forgotten about the heroic contribution of the Soviet army in the liberation of northern Norway from Nazi occupants – decided in the worst Cold War traditions to frighten the Norwegian audience with a non-existing threat from the east.

显然，北极有可能成为钢弧上的引爆点。

Clearly the Arctic has the potential to be a flashpoint on the Arc of Steel.

地中海居民

The Mediterranean

出于同样的原因，俄罗斯对在地中海的存在的渴望越来越强烈，这与中国对南海有争议岛屿的兴趣日益增长的原因相同：发现能源储备。考虑到新的钻井技术，东地中海的天然气和石油储量极有可能非常大且易于使用。31当然，天然气田的所有权必然会受到该地区许多国家的争夺，因为天然气一旦开发，其价值可能使拥有它的人成为世界上最富有的人均油价。

Russia’s desire for a presence in the Mediterranean has intensified for the same reason China’s interest in the disputed islands of the South China Sea has grown: the discovery of energy reserves. There is a real possibility that the natural gas and oil reserves in the Eastern Mediterranean are extremely large and accessible given new drilling technology.31 Of course, ownership of the gas fields is bound to be contested by many countries in the region, given that the value of the gas, once developed, could make whoever owns it the wealthiest in the world, per capita, even at a low oil price.

根据能源发现，以色列公司已经获得了大部分钻井权，以色列政府似乎相信这将导致其能源独立于其他日益动荡和敌对的地区。许可证由所有者塞浦路斯授予，该国破产，无法保卫领土，部分由北塞浦路斯土耳其共和国控制，该共和国也希望找到一种从气田中获得经济利益的方法。最终，希腊可能会挑战其古老的竞争对手塞浦路斯的所有权，土耳其、加沙、叙利亚和黎巴嫩也将如此，这些国家都有与这些气田接壤的海岸线。他们进入对话并不令人意外。与此同时，俄罗斯也面临很多风险。如果气田像地质调查所暗示的那样广泛，

Based on the energy discoveries, Israeli firms have acquired most of the drilling rights and Israel’s government seems to believe that this will lead to its energy independence from the rest of the increasingly turbulent and hostile region. The licences were granted by the owner, Cyprus, which is quite broke, incapable of defending the territory and partly controlled by the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus, which will also want to find a way to financially benefit from the gas fields. Eventually, Greece may challenge their ancient rival Cyprus over ownership, as will Turkey, Gaza, Syria and Lebanon, all of whom have coastlines that border these gas fields. Their entry into the conversation will not be a surprise. Meanwhile, Russia has much at stake. If the gas fields are as extensive as the geological surveys imply, Russia could lose the grip on Western Europe that it currently enjoys as the main nearby external supplier of gas.

人们想知道以色列的邻国是否真的希望看到该国在该地区享有能源独立。此外，人们普遍怀疑以色列已经升级了其核能力，现在有可能通过海豚级交付此类武器其舰队中的潜艇。32这具有特殊意义，因为俄罗斯与伊朗结盟已有一段时间，并向该国提供大部分导弹和反导弹系统。伊朗被以色列视为潜在的致命威胁。多年来，金融市场和其他观察家一直在猜测以色列是否有军事能力“取消”伊朗的核计划。讨论主要集中在一个简单的事实，即以色列缺乏为此目的使用飞机的空中加油能力。它也无法进入飞行路径。理论上，新的潜艇舰队可以让他们克服这些限制。当然，这不符合俄罗斯的利益。

One wonders whether Israel’s neighbours really want to see that nation enjoying energy independence from the region. Moreover, it is widely suspected that Israel has upgraded its nuclear capabilities and can now potentially deliver such weapons via the Dolphin-class submarines in its fleet.32 This has special significance given that Russia has been deeply aligned with Iran for some time and provides most of the missile and anti-missile systems to that nation. Iran is viewed by Israel as a potentially mortal threat. For years financial markets and other observers have speculated whether Israel had the military capacity to ‘take out’ Iran’s nuclear programme. The discussion mainly focused on the simple fact that Israel lacked the mid-air refuelling capacity to use planes for this purpose. It also lacked access to flight paths. The new submarine fleet may, in theory, allow them to overcome these constraints. Naturally, this is not in Russia’s interests.

也许现在埃及和俄罗斯真的有可能达成协议，让俄罗斯进入另一个温水港口。他们在亚历山大港有这样一个港口，直到 1972 年埃及总统安瓦尔·萨达特（Anwar Sadat）将俄罗斯赶出去（当时埃及与美国结盟）。现在埃及破产了，买不起或种植足够的小麦来满足其人口的需求。埃及是世界上最大的小麦进口国，如果说俄罗斯能提供一件事，那就是小麦（尤其是如果乌克兰和克里米亚仍由俄罗斯支配的话）。与此同时，国际货币基金组织、世界银行、欧盟和其他机构拒绝了埃及对小麦的请求，认为埃及没有偿还贷款的能力。

Perhaps there is now a real possibility that Egypt and Russia will agree on a deal giving Russia access to another a warm-water port. They had such a port in Alexandria until Egypt’s President Anwar Sadat pushed Russia out in 1972 (when Egypt aligned with the US). Now Egypt is broke and cannot afford to buy or grow enough wheat to placate the needs of its population. Egypt is the world’s largest importer of wheat and if there is one thing Russia can offer, it is wheat (especially if Ukraine and Crimea remain at Russia’s disposal). Meanwhile the IMF, the World Bank, the EU and others have declined Egypt’s pleas for wheat, arguing that Egypt has no means of repaying loans.

俄罗斯于 2013 年 6 月宣布打算在地中海保持永久存在。33美国于 2015 年 10 月宣布打算“加强”其在地中海的存在。34如果东地中海真的有 122 万亿立方英尺的天然气，那么我们必须预计，随着该地区的主要参与者争夺对能源及其现金流的控制权，世界的这一部分将在地缘政治上变得“嘈杂” .

Russia announced its intention to maintain a permanent presence in the Mediterranean in June 2013.33 The US announced its intention to ‘ramp up’ its presence in the Mediterranean in October 2015.34 If there really are 122 trillion cubic feet of natural gas in the Eastern Mediterranean, then we have to expect that this part of the world will become geopolitically ‘noisy’ as key players in the region vie for control over the energy and its cash flows.

希腊

Greece

如果希腊同意离开欧盟，俄罗斯会向希腊提供现金和信贷。正如一位匿名的俄罗斯官员所说，俄罗斯表示有兴趣获得“特定的硬资产”以换取金钱。希腊没有走这条路，但欧盟和北约官员都开始指责俄罗斯故意挑起难民涌入西欧，主要是通过希腊边境。北约欧洲盟军最高指挥官布里德洛夫将军说：“俄罗斯和阿萨德政权一起故意将移民武器化，以试图压倒欧洲结构并破坏欧洲的决心。”35

Russia offered Greece cash and credit if they would agree to leave the European Union. In exchange for money Russia expressed an interest in acquiring ‘particular hard assets’, as one anonymous Russian official was said to have put it. Greece did not go down that road but both EU and NATO officials have begun to accuse Russia of deliberately provoking the rush of refugees into Western Europe, mainly through the Greek border. General Breedlove, the Supreme Allied Commander Europe of NATO, said, ‘Together, Russia and the Assad regime are deliberately weaponising migration in an attempt to overwhelm European structures and break European resolve.’35

千岛群岛

Kuril Islands

并非所有的热点都在俄罗斯西部。有些在东方。俄罗斯和日本继续就两国都声称拥有主权的有争议的千岛群岛争论不休。当这些岛屿被誉为拥有大型天然气矿床以及世界上最大的铼（工业发动机所必需的）矿床以及其他矿产和资源时，这不足为奇。但也许对俄罗斯来说最重要的是，这些岛屿是他们进入北极的关键，也是俄罗斯重要的鱼蛋白供应商。

Not all flashpoints are to Russia’s West. Some are to the East. Russia and Japan continue to argue over the disputed Kuril Islands, which both nations claim. Hardly surprising when the islands are reputed to have large natural gas deposits as well as the world’s largest deposit of rhenium (which is essential for industrial engines), along with other minerals and resources. But perhaps most important for Russia is the fact that these islands are key to their ability to access the Arctic, as well as being a significant supplier of fish protein to Russia.

俄罗斯和伟大的游戏

Russia and the Great Game

俄罗斯建立和保留有价值资产的努力并不局限于其边界。与中国一样，俄罗斯的影响力也在扩大。它在“伟大的游戏”中发挥了自己的作用。2014年2月26日，俄罗斯国防部长谢尔盖绍伊古表示，俄罗斯正准备在越南、委内瑞拉、尼加拉瓜、塞舌尔、新加坡和吉布提等偏远地区建设军事基地。

Russia’s efforts to build and retain valuable assets are not restricted to its borders. Like China, Russia’s reach is expanding. It plays its own hand at the ‘Great Game’. On 26 February 2014, Russia’s Defence Minister, Sergei Shoigu, said that Russia was preparing to build military bases in Vietnam, Venezuela, Nicaragua, the Seychelles, Singapore and Djibouti, among other far-flung locales.

叙利亚

Syria

如果钢弧的顶端是北极，那么底端就是叙利亚。正如我所说，俄罗斯热衷于维持那里的拉塔基亚（Latakia）和塔尔图斯（Tartus）温水港口的所有权，他们现在将这些港口用作针对 DAESH/ISIS 的军事行动的主要基地。我们可以回顾一下俄罗斯最近卷入叙利亚的历史，但更重要的是一个简单的事实，即叙利亚代表了一个地区大国和全球超级大国现在正处于密切对抗的地方——这对世界经济产生了重要影响。

If the top end of the Arc of Steel is the Arctic, then the bottom end is Syria. As I’ve said, Russia is keen to maintain ownership of warm-water ports there, at Latakia and Tartus, which they now use as the main bases for the military actions against DAESH/ISIS. We could go into the history of Russia’s recent involvement in Syria, but what might matter more is the simple fact that Syria represents a place where regional powers and global superpowers are now in close confrontation – with important consequences for the world economy.

与其将叙利亚视为一个局部的、孤立的、独立的问题，不如将其置于更广泛的经济和地缘政治力量的背景下可能会有所帮助。叙利亚可能一开始是一个地方性的局部内乱问题，一场内战。但这也是两个最重要的地区大国沙特和伊朗之间发生冲突的地点，也是核超级大国美国和北约与俄罗斯发生冲突的爆发点。

Rather than viewing Syria as a local, isolated, standalone issue, it might be be helpful to put it into the context of a larger set of economic and geopolitical forces. It may be that Syria started out as a local and localised civil unrest problem, a civil war. But it is also the location of a conflict between Saudi and Iran, the two most important regional powers, as well as the flashpoint in which the nuclear superpowers, the US and NATO, come into conflict with Russia.

当我与该地区的政策制定者交谈时，我听说他们在很大程度上将正在发生的事件归咎于美国。无论对错，他们声称奥巴马总统在阿拉伯之春开始时实际上放弃了美国在该地区的主要盟友——即沙特和以色列。沙特人对美国选择支持整个地区的叛乱分子表示严重攻击，这些叛乱分子试图推翻他们长期独裁的领导人。

When I speak to policymakers from the region, I hear that they blame the US in large part for the unfolding events. Rightly or wrongly they claim that President Obama effectively abandoned America’s principal allies in the region when the Arab Spring began – namely Saudi and Israel. The Saudis took grave offence that America chose to support the rebels throughout the region who were attempting to turf out their long-standing and autocratic leaders.

世界那个地区的每一位决策者似乎都认为，小麦、面包和核心主食的价格上涨在释放导致阿拉伯之春的愤怒中发挥了重要作用，这一点非常明显。在前期，俄罗斯和澳大利亚的干旱推高了小麦的价格，进而推高了面包的价格。夹在全球经济放缓的痛苦和面包价格上涨之间，愤怒变成了抗议。统治埃及 30 年的胡斯尼·穆巴拉克 (Hosni Mubarak) 过去常说，他是通过确保“面包和马戏团”来做到这一点的。他的意思是字面意思，至少在面包的情况下。埃及的政治结构长期以来一直依赖于一个简单的基础：为穷人提供高度补贴、几乎免费的面包。

Every policymaker in that part of the world seems to think it is perfectly obvious that the rising price of wheat, bread and core food staples played a huge part in unleashing the anger that led to the Arab Spring. In the run-up, droughts in Russia and Australia had driven up the price of wheat and therefore bread. Caught between the pain of the global slowdown and the rising price of bread, anger turned into protest. Hosni Mubarak, who ruled Egypt for thirty years, used to say he did it by ensuring ‘bread and circuses’. He meant this literally, at least in the case of bread. Egypt’s political construct had long rested on one simple foundation: the provision of highly subsidised, practically free bread for the poor.

该地区小麦、面包和食品价格上涨的核心问题对每个人来说都是一样的。它提高了人们对社会契约不再服务于人民利益的认识。人们开始质疑，为什么大部分财富最终落入少数人手中，而大多数人却一无所有。

The central problem of higher wheat and bread and food prices across the region was the same for everybody. It raised awareness that the social contract was no longer serving the interests of the population. People began to ask why the bulk of the wealth was ending up in the hands of the few while the majority ended up with practically nothing.

当然，也有人反对这种观点。一些人认为，突尼斯和该地区其他国家的公民在没有太多警告的情况下，经过数十年的独裁统治，一天早上醒来就宣称：“今天是我必须拥有民主的日子！” 这不是真的。该地区的人民长期以来一直怀有不满情绪，并忍受着未满足的愿望；是什么让他们在那个特定时间突然崛起？

There are those who object to this notion, of course. Some believe that, without much warning and after decades of dictatorship, the citizens of Tunisia and other countries in the region simply woke up one morning and proclaimed, ‘Today is the day I have to have democracy!’ This does not ring true. The populations of this region have long harboured grievances and endured unmet aspirations; what made them suddenly rise up at that particular time?

引发阿拉伯之春的人是水果和蔬菜的销售商，这或许不是巧合。2010 年 12 月 17 日，26 岁的 Tarek al-Tayeb Mohamed Bouazizi 决定在光天化日之下用汽油自焚，以抗议统治突尼斯的 Zine El Abidine Ben Ali 的独裁领导二十三年。将布阿齐兹逼到绝境的不仅是食品价格上涨超出了顾客的承受能力，尽管毫无疑问，他会注意到这一点。他的主要抱怨是，包括警察在内的国家成员骚扰他，要求他支付越来越多的非正式甚至非法付款。这些开展业务的“税收”是新兴市场的主要内容。但是他的非正式税率的上升，再加上果蔬价格的上涨，已经超出了他的承受能力。他选择“退出”来抗议。Bouazizi 的死激发了广大公民走上街头推翻独裁政权。他的去世标志着阿拉伯之春的开始。

Perhaps it is not a coincidence that the man who triggered the Arab Spring was a fruit-and-vegetable seller. Tarek al-Tayeb Mohamed Bouazizi decided on 17 December 2010, at the age of twenty-six, to douse himself in petrol and set fire to himself in broad daylight in protest against the dictatorial leadership of Zine El Abidine Ben Ali, who had ruled Tunisia for twenty-three years. It wasn’t just the fact that food prices were rising beyond the reach of his customers that pushed Bouazizi over the edge, though he would have noticed that, no doubt; his main complaint was that members of the state, including the police, were harassing him for ever-larger informal and even illegal payments. These ‘taxes’ for doing business are a staple in emerging markets. But the rise in his informal tax rate, combined with the rise in the price of fruit and vegetables, was more than he could bear. He chose to protest by ‘exiting’. Bouazizi’s death inspired the citizens at large to take to the streets and overthrow the dictatorship. His demise marks the start of the Arab Spring.

一旦开始，社会抗议活动就蔓延到整个地区。世界各地的公民都感受到了全球经济放缓和生活成本上升的痛苦。回想起来，很多得出的结论是，量化宽松导致了质的挤压。但是，无论他们痛苦的原因是什么，对于公众来说，推动重新谈判社会契约已经足够严重了。人们想要一种新的社会契约，能够更公平、更明智地分配财富和经济机会。

Once underway, the social protests spread across the entire region. Citizens everywhere were feeling the pain of global slowdown in conjunction with the higher cost of living. In retrospect, many concluded that quantitative easing had led to qualitative squeezing. But, whatever the cause of their pain, it was sufficiently serious for the public to push for a renegotiation of the social contract. People wanted a new social contract that would parcel out the wealth and economic opportunity more fairly and more sensibly.

对沙特阿拉伯的影响是巨大的。由于其社会契约的性质，该王国可以说比该地区其他国家承受更大的压力。可以说，统治家族沙特王室被赋予了继续掌权的自由，尽管许多人认为王室可能没有公平地分享财富，甚至没有成为王室的最佳监护人。麦加。对沙特社会契约的一种看法是，它是基于权衡的。王室同意允许极端正统的瓦哈比宗教领袖有很大的自由（也许还可以为他们在国外的活动提供财政支持），以换取被允许控制国家的大量财富。36

The implications for Saudi Arabia have been enormous. The kingdom arguably has greater pressures than other countries in the region because of the nature of its social contract. It can be argued that the ruling family, the House of Saud, is given the latitude to remain in power, despite the fact that much of the population feel that the royal family might not be sharing the wealth fairly or even being the best guardians of Mecca. One take on the Saudi social contract is that it is based on a trade-off. The royal family agreed to permit the ultra-orthodox Wahhabi religious leaders a good deal of freedom (and perhaps financial support for their activities abroad) in exchange for being allowed to control the nation’s substantial wealth.36

沙特

Saudi

那么，是什么导致油价如此大幅下跌呢？在撰写本文时，它自 2014 年 6 月以来下降了约 70%。一种观点是供需失衡。这是简单的经济学：37供应过剩推动价格下跌。另一种观点认为，沙特非常刻意压低价格。他们的许多声明证明了这一点，这些声明证实了他们愿意让供过于求持续下去的意愿。在石油世界中，沙特人不再控制石油市场的定价，但他们仍然是世界上成本最低的生产国。因此，当他们暗示他们将允许价格继续下跌（通过不阻止供应）时，市场认为这意味着他们希望价格更低。

So, what caused the oil price to fall so very dramatically? At the time of writing it is down some 70 per cent since June 2014. One view is that supply and demand got out of whack. It was simple economics:37 Excess supply drove the price down. Another view is that the Saudis very deliberately pushed the price down. This was evidenced by their many statements, which confirmed their willingness to let the oversupply persist. In the oil world, the Saudis no longer control the pricing of the oil market but they remain the world’s lowest-cost producer. So when they intimate that they will permit the price to keep falling (by not withholding supply) the markets take this to mean that they want the price lower.

他们为什么要那样做？嗯，阴谋论层出不穷。但我认为这个故事的地缘政治因素值得考虑，因为低油价可能是中东已经“处于战争状态”的信号。

Why would they do that? Well, there are conspiracy theories galore. But I think it’s worth considering the geopolitical elements of the story, because the low oil price may be a signal that the Middle East is already ‘at war’.

首先，低油价伤害了谁？伊朗、俄罗斯和美国的压裂工业。所有这些都是沙特的竞争对手，威胁到其对油价的影响。

First, who does a lower oil price hurt? Iran, Russia and the American fracking industry. All these were rivals to Saudi, threatening its influence on the oil price.

与我交谈过的大多数沙特人都同意许多主流媒体所表达的理论。奥巴马总统在阿拉伯之春期间选择支持叛​​军，特别是在利比亚，沙特人对此感到震惊和愤怒。当总统开始谈到通过建立美国水力压裂工业来减少对中东的依赖时，他们感到很生气。这意味着流向沙特和其他生产商的现金流将随着时间的推移而受损。他们指责美国的干预以及从阿富汗和伊拉克撤军，让该地区陷入了一场混乱的噩梦。由于后者，该地区于 1913 年建立的旧赛克斯-皮科边界现在正在瓦解。美国人留下的真空正在迅速被对沙特人造成问题的团体填补，例如 DAESH/ISIS，

Most Saudis I have spoken to concur with the theory that is expressed in much of the mainstream media. The Saudis were shocked and outraged by the fact that President Obama chose to support the rebels, especially in Libya, during the Arab Spring. They were offended when the President began to speak of lessening dependence on the Middle East by building the US fracking industry. That meant cash flows to Saudi and other producers would be damaged over time. They blame the US for leaving the region in a messy nightmare, both with its intervention and its withdrawal from Afghanistan and Iraq. As a result of the latter, the old Sykes–Picot borders in the region, which were established in 1913, are now disintegrating. The vacuum the Americans are leaving behind is rapidly being filled by groups that are problematic for the Saudis, like DAESH/ISIS, Iran and Russia.

但也许从沙特的角度来看，最大的问题是美国未能帮助他们解决他们面临的最紧迫的生存威胁——伊朗核问题。事实上，总统做了一件沙特人没有预料到并且发现很难处理的事情：他决定与伊朗的关系正常化，并将其作为他担任总统的基石。

But perhaps the biggest problem, from a Saudi perspective, is that the US failed to assist them in the most pressing existential threat they face – the Iranian nuclear issue. In fact, the President did something the Saudis did not anticipate and are finding it hard to process: he decided to normalise relations with Iran and to make that the cornerstone achievement of his Presidency.

当然，美国人也对沙特人有抱怨。显然，沙特领导层在输出瓦哈比主义方面存在长期存在且仍未解决的问题，更不用说 9/11 的明显问题了。不过，很清楚的是，沙特阿拉伯和美国之间的关系可能因此而无法挽回地破裂。

Of course, the Americans have their complaints about the Saudis too. Obviously there are long-standing and still unresolved issues regarding the export of Wahhabism by the Saudi leadership, not to mention the obvious problem of 9/11. What is clear, though, is that the relationship between Saudi Arabia and the US is perhaps irretrievably broken down as a result of all this.

伊朗和俄罗斯

Iran and Russia

阿拉伯之春，连同所有这些其他事态发展，导致伊拉克、叙利亚和也门等国家陷入部落和地区冲突，因为当地人在没有统一力量的情况下开始争夺权力。根据沙特人的估计，这为伊朗创造了一个机会，可以“试一试”被削弱的沙特阿拉伯。这两个国家是长期争夺伊斯兰世界领袖地位的古老对手。

The Arab Spring, in conjunction with all these other developments, has caused nations like Iraq and Syria and Yemen to fall into tribal and regional conflicts as the locals began to vie for power in the absence of a unifying force. By the Saudis’ reckoning, this created an opportunity for Iran to ‘have a go’ at a weakened Saudi Arabia. These two countries are ancient rivals who have long sparred for the position of being leader of the Islamic world.

沙特人认为，伊朗在 1979 年 11 月 20 日企图控制麦加，是为了取代沙特王室。伊朗支持的 Juhaymin al-Uteybi 领导了数百名支持者，他们对麦加进行了 7 天的实际控制。他们宣布了一位新的伊斯兰教精神领袖“马赫迪”，他将成为麦加和伊斯兰教的更好守护者。沙特人不得不引进法国伞兵来恢复对伊斯兰世界最神圣场所的控制。

The Saudis believe that Iran’s attempt to take control of Mecca on 20 November 1979 was intended to displace the House of Saud. The Iranian-backed Juhaymin al-Uteybi led a group of many hundreds of supporters who took physical control of Mecca for seven days. They declared a new spiritual leader of Islam, a ‘Mahdi’, who would be a better guardian of Mecca and Islam. The Saudis had to bring in French paratroopers to restore control over the holiest site in the Islamic world.

沙特人无论对错，都认为伊朗在叙利亚、也门和该地区其他地区帮助沙特反对者。大多数分析侧重于推动也门胡塞叛乱的当地政治和社会问题或叙利亚局势的拜占庭政治；这种自上而下的方法有其优点，但也有自上而下的方面。沙特阿拉伯现在认为自己在也门和叙利亚等当地代理地点与伊朗进行区域超级大国战争。他们将这些视为超级大国，即美国和俄罗斯，也在进行代理人战争的地方。

The Saudis, rightly or wrongly, believe that Iran is assisting Saudi opponents in Syria, in Yemen and in other parts of the region. Most analyses focus on the local political and social issues driving the Houthi rebellion in Yemen or the Byzantine politics of the Syrian situation; this ground-up approach has its merits, but there is a top-down aspect too. Saudi Arabia now views itself as being in a regional superpower war with Iran in local proxy locations like Yemen and Syria. They see these as places where the superpowers, namely the US and Russia, are engaging in proxy wars as well.

伊朗、俄罗斯和中国之间的结盟在一个层面上是有道理的：伊朗是该地区唯一与美国不结盟的主要石油供应国。俄罗斯向伊朗出售先进的武器系统，例如 Almaz-Antey S-300 和 S-400 远程高空地对空导弹，它们可以瞄准和发现远远超出伊朗边界的飞机和导弹。他们在伊朗方面的存在引发了很多关于美国武器系统将如何运作的猜测反对他们。38中国也向伊朗提供从 J-10 战斗机到先进巡航导弹的尖端武器系统。

The alignment between Iran and Russia and China makes sense on one level: Iran was the only major oil supplier in the region that was not aligned with the US. Russia sells sophisticated weapons systems to Iran, such as the Almaz-Antey S-300 and S-400 long-range high-altitude surface-to-air missiles that can target and find planes and missiles well beyond Iran’s borders. Their presence on the Iranian side has led to much speculation about how American weapons systems would fare against them.38 China too provides Iran with sophisticated weapons systems from J-10 fighter jets to advanced cruise missiles.

一种观点认为，沙特人认为，通过压低油价，他们可以剥夺伊朗和俄罗斯进行这一地区代理人之争所需的预算。当然，较低的油价也会伤害沙特。但他们可以比伊朗和俄罗斯屏住呼吸的时间更长，伊朗和俄罗斯需要油价远高于每桶 120 美元才能实现收支平衡，而且会因收入损失而遭受重创。当然，伊朗和俄罗斯都否认他们有麻烦。

One school of thought is that the Saudis believed, by pushing the oil price down, they could deprive Iran and Russia of the budget they needed to pursue this regional proxy fight. Certainly, a lower oil price would hurt the Saudis too; but they could hold their breath longer than Iran and Russia, who needed oil to fetch well above $120 a barrel for their budgets to break even and would be devastated by the loss of income. Of course both Iran and Russia deny that they are in trouble.

似乎没有人预料到的是，沙特人将无法承受这种痛苦。不过，即使在油价暴跌之前，就有迹象表明沙特政府正在控制预算：2013 年，该国放弃了在沙漠中种植小麦的 30 年努力，称其成本过高。39到 2016 年，新任副王储穆罕默德·本·纳耶夫（Mohammed bin Nayef，简称 MbN）是前情报部门负责人的儿子，也是萨勒曼国王的侄子，已经开始发表声明，确认沙特经济陷入困境。此外，它们表明沙特的社会契约正在瓦解。

What no one seems to have anticipated is that the Saudis would be unable to bear the pain. Though, even before the oil price collapsed, there had been signals that the Saudi government was reining in its budget: in 2013 the kingdom abandoned its thirty-year effort to grow wheat in the desert, saying it had become too expensive.39 By 2016 the new Deputy Crown Prince, Mohammed bin Nayef (known as MbN), son of the former Head of Intelligence and the nephew of King Salman, had begun to make announcements that confirm the Saudi economy is in trouble. Moreover they signal that the social contract in Saudi is unravelling.

在提供汽油、食品和住房补贴多年后，2016 年 1 月 28 日，沙特政府宣布将大幅减少补贴，电力、柴油和煤油均受到影响，汽油补贴下降 50%。除此之外，还将实施增值税，将商品成本提高 20% 左右。并且在王国历史上第一次发行主权债务。此外，沙特开始提出控制沙特大部分石油生产的沙特阿美公司可能会通过 IPO 出售给投资者的想法。这一切都证实了沙特的社会契约承受着历史性的财政压力。

After years of providing subsidised petrol, food and housing, on 28 January 2016 the Saudi government announced that subsidies would be substantially reduced, with electricity, diesel and kerosene all affected, and the subsidy on petrol falling by 50 per cent. On top of this VAT would be implemented, raising the cost of goods by something like 20 per cent. And for the first time in the kingdom’s history, sovereign debt would be issued. In addition, the Kingdom began to float the idea that Saudi Aramco, which controls the bulk of Saudi oil production, would potentially be sold to investors in an IPO. All this confirmed that the social contract in Saudi was under historic financial pressure.

我之所以说社会契约，是因为很明显，与该地区其他地方一样，沙特公民不再满足于看到如此多的财富最终掌握在少数人手中。中东越来越多的公众要求王室更广泛地分享他们的财富，因为油价下跌可能会削弱他们的创收能力。

I say the social contract because it is clear that the citizens in Saudi, as elsewhere in the region, are no longer content to see so much wealth end up in the hands of so few. Increasingly the public across the Middle East are requiring the royal families to share their wealth more broadly at the very moment that their capacity to generate revenue may be weakened by the fall in the oil price.

这一切都发生在地区边界的解体和地区战争的加剧正在引发规模巨大的难民问题之际。沙特一直非常不愿意接收任何难民或资助他们。这部分是因为预算已经不堪重负，这一事实使他们在该地区的对手面前显得很脆弱，比如伊朗，因此他们似乎有胆量挑战他们。他们不能再通过简单地向公众开支票来“购买”和平。

This all comes at a time when the dissolution of regional borders and the intensification of regional wars is giving rise to a refugee problem of epic proportions. Saudi has been extremely reluctant to take any refugees or to finance them. This is in part because the budget is already overwhelmed, a fact which makes them appear vulnerable to their opponents in the region, like Iran, which seems emboldened to challenge them as a result. They can no longer ‘buy’ the peace by simply writing cheques to the public.

时间、通货膨胀、战争

Time, inflation, war

因此，综上所述，我们看到了许多来自地缘政治格局的驱动和发出的信号。中国、俄罗斯和中东地区大国都非常清楚，食品价格与国内稳定密不可分。石油本身已成为军事紧张和地缘政治对抗的信号。所有这些地方的社会契约都需要以一种或另一种方式得到满足。一种可能性是政府寻找新的支出形式。市场如此渴望拥有的QE4，会不会以军费的形式出现？在国外找到对手可以帮助转移当地民众对他们的社会契约正在瓦解这一事实的愤怒。美国人很快就说，这就是俄罗斯和中国正在发生的事情。40的利率政策。大多数新兴市场都忍不住认为美国制造更多通货膨胀的努力不利于他们的利益。

So, taken together, what we see are many signals both driving and emanating from the geopolitical landscape. China, Russia and regional powers in the Middle East are all critically aware that food prices and domestic stability are inseparably linked. Oil itself has emerged as a signal of military tension and geopolitical confrontation. The social contracts in all these places need to be met one way or another. One possibility is for governments to find new forms of spending. Could it be that QE4, which the markets are so anxious to have, may come in the form of military spending? Finding an opponent abroad can help divert the local population’s anger about the fact that their social contract is unravelling. The Americans are quick to say that this is what is happening in both Russia and China. But those two are equally quick to point out that America, too, needs an excuse to pump money into the economy given that it’s hit the ‘zero bound’40 of interest rate policy. Most of the emerging markets can’t help but view America’s efforts to generate more inflation as hostile to their interests.

美国告诉他们对自己的经济负责的事实只会增加他们这样做的机会。他们将更加努力地获得生存所需的东西。这样，我们可能会发现蛋白质是新的油。“钢铁之弧”和“一带一路”只是对一个负债国家试图通过煽动通货膨胀来处理债务的世界所带来的问题的答案。这是一个令人担忧的信号，西方盟友似乎在相互争吵，而有些人则演奏格雷格的 A 小调钢琴协奏曲。

The fact that the US tells them to take responsibility for their own economies merely increases the chances that they will do just that. They will reach harder for what they need to survive. In this way, we may find that protein is the new oil. The Arc of Steel and the One Belt One Road are simply answers to the problem posed by a world in which the indebted countries try to deal with their debt by fomenting inflation. It is a worrying signal that the Western allies seem to be squabbling amongst themselves while some play Greig’s Piano Concerto in A minor.

正如卡尔·冯·克劳塞维茨（Carl von Clausewitz）令人难忘的所说，“战争是政治通过其他方式的延续”。他所说的“政治”是指所有的“政策”和“政治”。也许今天同样的想法也在发挥作用，而军事冲突仅仅是货币政策以其他方式的延续。

As Carl von Clausewitz memorably said, ‘War is the continuation of Politik by other means’. By ‘politik’ he meant all ‘policy’ and ‘politics’. Perhaps this same idea is in play today and military conflict is merely a continuation of monetary policy by other means.

这里的赌注非常高

The stakes here are very high

历史学家玛格丽特麦克米伦警告说，今天的局势与 1914 年大战前夕之间存在危险的相似之处。在押韵和理性：为什么 2014 年不一定是 1914 年，她写道：“1914 年 100 周年应该让我们重新思考我们对人为错误、突发灾难和纯粹事故的脆弱性。今天管理这些漏洞的难度可能会更大，因为“通信速度比以往任何时候都给政府施加了更大的压力来应对危机。” . . 在他们有时间制定一个衡量的反应之前。41

The historian Margaret Macmillan has warned of dangerous parallels between the situation today and the run-up to the Great War of 1914. In Rhyme and Reason: Why 2014 doesn’t have to be 1914, she writes: ‘The 100th anniversary of 1914 should make us reflect anew on our vulnerabilities to human error, sudden catastrophe, and sheer accident.’ The difficulty of managing such vulnerabilities may be even worse today because ‘the speed of communications puts greater than ever pressure on government to react to crises . . . before they have time to formulate a measured response.’41

这一切都让我们想起欧内斯特·海明威在 1935 年 9 月写的公开信，他在信中警告欧洲有可能再次爆发战争：货币; 二是战争。两者都带来暂时的繁荣；两者都会带来永久的毁灭。42

All this begs us to recall the open letter Ernest Hemingway wrote in September 1935 in which he warned of the risk of another war in Europe: ‘The first panacea for a mismanaged nation is inflation of the currency; the second is war. Both bring a temporary prosperity; both bring a permanent ruin.’42

战争显然不是任何人的第一选择，甚至是最后选择。没有人想要战争，但在一个产能过剩和/或资金过多的世界里，经济力量可以合谋摧毁过剩产能和过剩资本。在这种破坏中，没有什么比冲突更有效的了。今天，战争的舞台越来越多。各国在物理空间上相互竞争，以获取商品，争取幻想破灭和痛苦的公民的忠诚。事故可能发生。可以犯错误。

War is obviously nobody’s first or even last choice. No one wants war, but in a world where there is excess capacity and/or too much money, economic forces can conspire to destroy excess capacity and excess capital. Nothing is more efficient at this destruction than conflict. Today the stage is increasingly set for war. States are competing with each other over physical spaces for access to commodities, for the loyalty of their disillusioned and pained citizens. Accidents can happen. Mistakes can be made.

我们必须小心或至少意识到我们的选择。

We must be careful or at least cognisant of our choices.

可能值得重新审视这样一个概念，即摆脱繁重的债务问题的途径有限：

It might be worth revisiting the notion that there are only a limited number of paths out of a burdensome debt problem:

1.承受痛苦并接受通货紧缩。像日本或欧洲大陆一样，牺牲多年的增长和一两代人来管理债务而不违约；

1. Take the pain and accept the deflation. Be like Japan or Continental Europe and sacrifice many years of growth and a generation or two to the process of managing the debt without default;

2.引入通货膨胀；

2. Introduce inflation;

3.冲突和战争；

3. Conflict and war;

4.或者，通过创新发展自己的出路。

4. Or, grow your way out through innovation.

幸运的是，正如我们将看到的，创新正在进行中。. .

Luckily, innovation is underway, as we shall see . . .

31位于以色列地中海沿岸的 Tamar 气田和 Leviathan 气田分别为 10 万亿立方英尺 (TCF) 和 19 万亿立方英尺 (TCF)。埃兰·阿兹兰（Eran Azran），“利维坦气田是确定无疑的事情还是有问题的鲸鱼？” 国土报，2014 年 1 月 26 日。

3110 trillion cubic square feet (TCF) at the Tamar gas field and 19 trillion cubic feet (TCF) at Leviathan gas field, both off the Mediterranean coast of Israel. Eran Azran, ‘Is the Leviathan gas field a sure thing or a whale of a problem?’ Haaretz, 26 January 2014.

33Alexei Anishchuk，“俄罗斯宣布永久地中海海军存在”，路透社，2013 年 6 月 6 日。

33Alexei Anishchuk, ‘Russia Announces Permanent Mediterranean Naval Presence’, Reuters, 6 June 2013.

34David Larter, ‘Navy 6th Fleet ramps up to face Russia, ISIS’, Navy Times, 19 October 2015.

36Karen Armstrong, ‘Wahhabism to ISIS: how Saudi Arabia exported the main source of global terrorism’, New Statesman, 7 November 2014.

37Clifford Krauss，“油价：下跌的原因是什么？《简单经济学》，《纽约时报》，2016 年 2 月 9 日。

37Clifford Krauss, ‘Oil prices: What’s behind the drop? Simple Economics’, New York Times, 9 February 2016.

38Dave Mujamdar，“美国 F-22 和 B-2 轰炸机与俄罗斯的 S-300 在叙利亚：谁赢了？” 国家利益，2015 年 9 月 22 日。

38Dave Mujamdar, ‘American F-22s and B-2 Bombers vs Russia’s S-300 in Syria: Who Wins?’ National Interest, 22 September 2015.

39Diana Al-Jassem，“王国到 2016 年停止小麦生产”，阿拉伯新闻，2013 年 4 月 14 日。

39Diana Al-Jassem, ‘Kingdom to halt wheat production by 2016’, Arab News, 14 April 2013.

40“零界限”是指利率降至零或接近零的时候。

40‘Zero bound’ is when interest rates have fallen to zero or nearly zero.

41Margaret Macmillan，历史韵律：大战的教训，布鲁金学会，2013 年 12 月 14 日。

41Margaret Macmillan, The Rhyme of History: Lessons of the Great War, Brooking Institution, 14 December 2013.

421935 年 9 月，首次发表在Esquire杂志上的“下一场战争笔记：一封严肃的主题信” 。

42‘Notes on the Next War: A Serious Topical Letter’, first published in Esquire magazine, September 1935.

 

 

10

10

革新

Innovation

这一切听起来都很艰难。地形多岩石。信心和信心似乎遇到了一个特别艰难的时期。尽管有大量量化宽松和现金进入世界经济，但信心和增长正在动摇。我们想要换取QE的所有好东西都还没有到来，许多不良影响已经蓄势待发。失业率和租金都太高了。增长和贷款都太低了。2016 年全球金融市场开盘时亏损惊人。

This all sounds pretty tough. The terrain is rocky. Faith and confidence seems to have hit an especially rough patch. In spite of all the QE and cash that has gone into the world economy, confidence and growth are faltering. All the good things we wanted in exchange for QE have not yet arrived, and many of the ill-effects have gained momentum. Unemployment and rents are both too high. Growth and lending are too low. Financial markets worldwide opened with stunning losses in 2016.

是的，压力是严峻的，但它们促进了经济可持续增长所需的一件事：创新。如果我坚持我的信念，即 GDP 是在人类灵魂中创造的，那么艰难的环境正是导致自我反省的原因，而这种反省反过来又会导致有计划的冒险和创新，从而构成明天经济的基础。

Yes, the pressures are grim, but they promote the one thing that is required for the economy to sustainably grow: innovation. If I stick to my belief that GDP is created in the human soul, then tough circumstances are exactly what lead to the soul-searching that in turn leads to calculated risk-taking and innovation which forms the foundation of tomorrow’s economy.

不信的人会说做不到。他们会断言，没有新的硅谷，没有新的金融服务部门，没有新产品可以取代那些已经崩溃和烧毁的经济部分。但事实是，没有办法预测人们会创造什么。唯一真正的问题是我们是否选择“成为改变者”。唯一的另一种选择是屈服于全球经济将强加给我们的变化，无论我们喜欢与否。圣雄甘地的建议是前者：“如果我们能改变自己，世界的趋势也会改变。当一个人改变他的自己的本性，世界对他的态度也随之改变。. . 我们不必等待，看看其他人做了什么。1

Unbelievers will say it cannot be done. They’ll assert that there is no new Silicon Valley, no new equivalent of the financial services sector, no new product that can replace those parts of the economy that have crashed and burned. But the fact is, there is no way to anticipate what people may create. The only real question is whether or not we choose to ‘be the change’. The only other option is to surrender to the change the global economy will force on us, whether we like it or not. Mahatma Gandhi’s advice was to be the former: ‘If we could change ourselves, the tendencies in the world would also change. As a man changes his own nature, so does the attitude of the world change towards him . . . We need not wait to see what others do.’1

有人会说这一切都很好，但不会发生任何积极的事情，因为对于最需要资金的人来说，资金将是稀缺的。中央银行的资产负债表可能扩大了许多倍，但现在要获得商业贷款、透支或抵押贷款要困难得多。然而，有限的资源实际上可以激发人们追求真正有回报的想法。亚马逊创始人兼首席执行官杰夫·贝佐斯认为，无法获得资金是一种很好的纪律。他说，亚马逊最成功的商业决策通常是由资金最紧缺的团队做出的，因此被迫运用想象力和独创性来解决问题。

Some will say that’s all very well, but nothing positive can happen because capital will be scarce for those who need it most. The central banks may have expanded their balance sheets by many multiples, but it is much harder now to get a business loan, an overdraft or a mortgage. However, limited resources can actually stimulate people to pursue the ideas that really pay off. Jeff Bezos, founder and CEO of Amazon, believes that lack of access to capital is a great discipline. He says the most successful business decisions at Amazon have usually been made by the teams that were the most capital constrained and therefore forced to use imagination and ingenuity to solve problems.
